children.definition: not inquired into, unknown, κείνου δʼ . . ὄλεθρον ἀπευθέα θῆκεν Od. 3.88, cf. Arat. 259, etc.; ἀ. ἀκοῇ Max.Tyr. 17.9 [11.9.d].

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not inquiring, ignorant, ἦλθον . . ἀπευθής Od. 3.184, cf. Cerc. 5.3: c. gen., D.P. 194, APl. 16.303.
adjustment, setting, Paul.Aeg. 6.92.
one must set straight, adjust, Sor. 2.60.
make straight, restore, πάντα ὀρθὰ ἀ. Pl. Ti. 71d; χέρας δεσμοῖς ἀ. bind his arms straight, i.e. behind him, S. Aj. 72: metaph., ἀπευθύνεται τὸ ὑποκλάζον τοῦ πυρετοῦ Paul.Aeg. 2.47.

children.label: b
children.definition: dress, λόχον Ascl. Tact. 12.11, etc.

guide aright, direct, δεῦρʼ ἀ. μολεῖν A. Ag. 1667; ἀ. βροτῶν τοὺς ἀγνωμοσύναν τιμῶντας corrects, chastises them, E. Ba. 884 (lyr.); ἐκ πρύμνης ἀ. to steer, Pl. Criti. 109c; πλήκτροις ἀ. τρόπιν S. Fr. 143, cf. Ichn. l.c.; ἀ. πόλιν govern, rule, Id. OT 104; ἀ.τὰ κοινά Aeschin. 3.158; κλήρῳ ἀ. [τὴν ἰσότητα] regulate, Pl. Lg. 757b, cf. Plt. 282e; ἀ. τι πρός τι to adjust, Arr. Epict. 4.12.16, cf. Luc. Im. 12; ταῖς συλλαβαῖς ἀ. τοὺς χπόνους D.H. Comp. 11.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ ἀπευθυσμένον (sc. ἔντερον) intestinum rectum, Dsc. 1.99, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.55, Gal. 2.573, etc.
without resin, Thphr. HP 3.9.3 (in Comp. -ότερος.)
Pl. Ax. 369b ( Sup.), Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.289b; τάραχοι CPHerm. 119r iv 16 (iii A.D.), cf. A.D. Synt. 252.10. Adv. -αίως to the loss of our hopes, [ τελευτῆσαι] POxy. 1114.24 (iii A.D.).
deprecatory, ὕμνοι Men.Rh. p.342S.

definition: ἀπευκτός, ή, όν, Luc. Pseudol. 12, Hld. 7.25: ( ἀπεύχομαι):—

children.definition: to be deprecated, abominable, πήματα A. Ag. 638; ἀ. τὸ δεηθῆναι τούτων Pl. Lg. 628c; τὰ ἀ. Id. Ep. 353e.
of irregular shape, dub. in Hero *Stereom. 2.32.
expedio, explico, exploro, Gloss.
lull to sleep, ἀπευνασθέντος κακοῦ ( ἀπʼ εὐνασθέντος κ. cod. L) S. Tr. 1242.
Hsch.
deliver or pay regularly, τοὺς φόρους Str. 4.6.9:— Pass., Id. 7.4.6, UPZ 42.15 (ii B.C.).
Hsch.
deprecate, v.l.for ἐπευφημέω, Philostr. VA 5.19, 7.10.
politeness, Phld. Lib. p.56O.
show gratitude, τινί IG 5(1).1145.35 ( Gythium).
deprecation, Men.Rh. p.343S. (pl.).

wish a thing away, wish it may not happen, c. acc. rei, ἀπεύχου ταῦτα, πρὸς θεῶν E. Hipp. 891; τί μάλιστʼ ἂν ἀπευξαίμεθα; D. 20.157; ἀ. τι τοῖς θεοῖς μηδαμῶς γίγνεσθαι pray the gods it may not be, Pl. Lg. 687d, cf. D. 8.51: without μή, ἀπεύχεσθε ἰδεῖν Id. 6.23, cf. 20.106: also τοῦτο . . μὴ γένοιτο . . ἀπεύχομαι Ar. Th. 714.

children.label: II
children.definition: reject, despise, μητρὸς αἷμα A. Eu. 608.

children.label: III
children.definition: avert by prayer, Philostr. VA 6.41.
scorch off, v. ἀφεύω.
cheapen, dub. in Luc. Nigr. 23.
abundantly, dub. in Str. 15.1.24.

definition: ἄπεφθος, ον, by dissimilation for ἄφεφθος, ( ἀφέψω)

children.definition: boiled down, ἄ. χρυσός refined gold, Thgn. 449, Hdt. 1.50; χρυσίον Th. 2.13; ὕδωρ ἄ. water purified by boiling, Alex. 198; μέλι ἄ. despumated, Sor. 1.118.
hate utterly, detest, τινά Il. 3.415, Opp. H. 5.420, Jul. Or. 2.86b, Vett.Val. 349.14:— Med., aor. 1 ἀπηχθήραντο Q.S. 13.255.

children.label: II
children.definition: make utterly hateful, ὅς τέ μοι ὕπνον ἀ. καὶ ἐδωδήν Od. 4.105.

data.quote: ὅς τέ μοι ὕπνον ἀ. καὶ ἐδωδήν

definition: ἀπεχθάνομαι, Od. 2.202, Ar. Pl. 910, Pl. Ap. 24a, etc.: impf. ἀπηχθανόμην Cratin. 36, X. An. 7.7.10: fut. ἀπεχθήσομαι Hdt. 1.89, E. Alc. 71, Pl. Phlb. 28d, etc.; ἀπεχθᾰνοῦμαι Them. Or. 26.322c: pf. ἀπήχθημαι Th. 1.75, 2.63, X. An. 7.6.34, etc.: aor. ἀπηχθόμην Il. 24.27, etc.; subj. ἀπέχθωμαι ib. 4.53; inf. ἀπεχθέσθαι (not ἀπέχθεσθαι), v. ἀπέχθομαι; part. ἀπεχθόμενος Pl. Min. 321a: ( ἔχθος):—

children.definition: Pass., to be hated, incur hatred, ἀπεχθάνεαι δʼ ἔτι μᾶλλον Od. 2.202; elswh. in Hom. always in aor., mostly c. dat. pers., to be or become hateful to one, incur his hate, ἀπήχθετο πᾶσι θεοῖσι Il. 6.140; ἶσον γάρ σφιν πᾶσιν ἀπήχθετο κηρὶ μελαίνῃ 3.454; οὔτε τί μοι πᾶς δῆμος ἀπεχθόμενος χαλεπαίνει nor does the people roused to hate against me distress me, Od. 16.114; σοὶ ἐμέθεν ἀπήχθετο φροντίσδην Sapph. 41, Hdt. 1.89, 3.1, Antipho 6.11, Th. 1.136, etc.; ἀ. πρός τινα to be hateful in his eyes, E. Med. 290; to be irritated against, πρὸς τὴν ἡγεμονίαν Plu. Galb. 18, cf. J. AJ 13.9.3: c. dat. rei, to be hated for a thing, Pl. Ap. 24a, cf. Th. 2.63 (but also in act. sense, dislike, τῇ φιλοσοφίᾳ, τῷ οἴνῳ Philostr. VA 3.22, Im. 2.17): c. part., ἀ. ποιῶν And. 4.10; θριάμβους ἀναρύτουσʼ ἀπηχθάνου Cratin. 36.

data.quote: ἶσον γάρ σφιν πᾶσιν ἀπήχθετο κηρὶ μελαίνῃ

children.label: II
children.definition: λόγοι ἀπεχθανόμενοι language that causes hatred, opp. οἳ πρὸς φιλίαν ἄγουσι, X. Smp. 4.58.
hatred,
πρός τινα D. 18.36, Arist. Pol. 1305a23; διὰ τὴν ἀ. τοῦ πάθους for it, ib. 1274a40.

enmity, odium, ὁ πράξας τὴν ἀ. αὐτῶν δίκαιος φέρεσθαι Antipho 3.4.2, cf. Pl. Ap. 28a, D. 3.13, etc.: in pl., enmities, Pl. Ap. 23a, interpol. in D. 9.64; θεοῖς διʼ ἀπεχθείας ἐλθεῖν to be hated by them, A. Pr. 121 (lyr.); διʼ ἀ. γίγνεταί τι it becomes hateful, X. Hier. 9.2; οὔτʼ ἐκείνου πρὸς χάριν οὔτʼ ἐμοῦ πρὸς ἀπέχθειαν D. 5.7; ἀπέχθειαν φέρει τι it brings odium, Id. Prooem. 44; πολλὴν ἔχει ἀ. Arist. Pol. 1322a2; δείσας τὴν πρὸς ὑμᾶς ἀ. enmity with you, Isoc. 8.38; μετὰ πολλῆς ἀ. Plb. 1.66.9.

data.quote: ὁ πράξας τὴν ἀ. αὐτῶν δίκαιος φέρεσθαι

children.definition: yesterday, A.D. Synt. 235.26:—divisim ἀπʼ ἐχθές AP 11.35 ( Phld.).
odious, noxious, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.33.
object of hate, E. Tr. 425.

definition: ἀπεχθήμων, ον, gen. -ονος, worse form for sq., Poll. 8.153.

children.definition: hateful, S. Ant. 50; hostile, Theoc. 1.101; τὸ ἀ. Onos. 37.3: Sup., Ph. 1.604.

children.label: II
children.definition: hated, Isoc. 1.12 (dub.l.); δάκρυα IG 4.622 ( Argos). Adv. -θῶς, ἔχειν τινί D. 5.18; διακεῖσθαι D.Chr. 32.70; πρός τινας D.H. 7.31: Sup. -έστατα Poll. 5.116.
full of hatred, envious, opp. κόλαξ, Arist. MM 1193a22, EE 1221a26, 1233b32.

definition: ἀπέχθομαι, later form of ἀπεχθάνομαι, Theoc. 7.45, Lyc. 116, AP 5.176 ( Mel.), Plu. Marc. 22, etc.; for in E. Hipp. 1260 ἐπάχθομαι is the better reading; and the inf. ἀπέχθεσθαι freq. found in codd. should be written ἀπεχθέσθαι, cf. ἀπεχθάνομαι.

children.definition: to be hostile, Phld. Rh. 2.162S.

definition: ἀπέχω, fut. ἀφέξω, and ( Od. 19.572) ἀποσχήσω: aor. ἀπέσχον:—

children.definition: keep off or away from, αἴ κεν τυδέος υἱὸν ἀπόσχη Ἰλίου ἱρῆς Il. 6.96, 277; ἑκὰς νήσων ἀπέχων εὐεργέα νῆα Od. 15.33; κληῖδες ἀπʼ ὤμων αὐχένʼ ἔχουσιν the collar-bone parts the neck from the shoulders, Il. 22.324; Εὐβοίης ἀπέχειν . . αἶγας Orac. ap. Hdt. 8.20, cf. 22; ἄπεχε τῆς βοὸς τὸν ταῦρον A. Ag. 1125 (lyr.), cf. Pr. 687 (lyr.).

data.quote: αἴ κεν τυδέος υἱὸν ἀπόσχη Ἰλίου ἱρῆς

children.definition: τοι . . χεῖρας ἀφέξω Od. 20.263.
ἀ. φρένα περισσῶν παρὰ φωτῶν E. Ba. 427 (lyr.); ῥῖνα ἀπὸ κάκκης Ar. Pax 162.
keep off or away, σκοτεινὸν ἀ. ψόγον Pi. N. 7.61; ἀ. φάσγανον E. Or. 1519.
οὐδὲν ἀπέχει c. inf., nothing hinders, debars one from doing, Pl. Cra. 407b, Plu. Def.orac. 2.433a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., κακῶν ἄπο χεῖρας ἔχεσθαι hold oneʼs hands off or away from . ., Od. 22.316; κυάμων ἄπο χεῖρας ἔχεσθε Emp. 141; ἀθανάτων ἀ. χεῖρας A. Eu. 350 (lyr.), cf. Supp. 756, Pl. Smp. 213d, 214d:—but mostly,

ἀπέχεσθαί τινος hold oneself off a thing, abstain or desist from it, πολέμου Il. 8.35, al.; βοῶν Od. 12.321; οὐδὲ . . σευ ἀφέξομαι will not keep my hands off thee, ib. 19.489; Δεκελέης abstain from ravaging D., Hdt. 9.73, cf. 1.66, 4.118, al., Th. 1.20, etc.; keep away from, πόλεως X. HG 7.3.10: in pf. Pass., μηδὲ τῶν μικρῶν ἀπεσχημένον D. 27.47; ἀγορᾶς ἀπεσχ. Arist. Pol. 1278a25.

inf., ἀπέχεσθαι μὴ στρατεῦσαι abstain from marching, Th. 5.25; λαμβάνειν ἀπέσχετο Philem. 94.3; ἀπέχεσθαι τοῦ ποιεῖν X. Mem. 4.2.3; οὐκ ἀ. τὸ μὴ οὐ ποιεῖν Id. Cyr. 1.6.32, Pl. R. 354b: also c. part., Jul. Or. 1.43d.

data.quote: οὐκ ἀ. τὸ μὴ οὐ ποιεῖν

children.definition: refrain oneself, D. 21.61.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., to be away or far from, c. gen. loci, τῶν Ἐπιπολῶν ἓξ ἢ ἑπτὰ σταδίους Th. 6.97; ἀ.ἀπὸ Βαβυλῶνος, etc., Hdt. 1.179, cf. 3.26, al.; ἀπὸ θαλάττης . . δώδεκα ὁδὸν ἡμερῶν ἀ. Euphro 11.3; ἀ. παμπόλλων ἡμερῶν ὁδόν X. Cyr. 1.1.3; τὸ μέσον ἴσον τῶν ἐσχάτων ἀ. Pl. Prm. 145b; πλεῖστον ἀ. κατὰ τόπον Arist. Mete. 363a31; ἀ. τὴν ἡμίσειαν διάμετρον Id. Cael. 293b30, etc.

data.quote: τῶν Ἐπιπολῶν ἓξ ἢ ἑπτὰ σταδίους
ἀπὸ θαλάττης . . δώδεκα ὁδὸν ἡμερῶν ἀ.
τὸ μέσον ἴσον τῶν ἐσχάτων ἀ.

children.label: b
children.definition: project, extend, Id. GA 781a11; τὰ ἀπέχοντα prominent parts, PA 655a32.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἀποσχὼν τεσσαράκοντα μάλιστα σταδίους μὴ φθάσαι ἐλθών failing to arrive in time by . ., Th. 5.3.

to be far from, ἀπεῖχον τῆς ἐξευρέσιος οὐδὲν ἔλασσον were just as far from the discovery, Hdt. 1.67; τοσοῦτον ἀπέχω τοῦ ποιεῖν τι ὥστε . . Isoc. 6.70; τοσούτῳ πλέον ἡμῶν ἀπέχεις τοῦ πιστὰ λέγειν ὅσον . . ib. 11.32; ἀπέχει τοῦ μὴ μετʼ ὀργῆς [πράττειν] D. 21.41; πλεῖστον ἀ. τινός to be as far as possible from doing, X. Mem. 1.2.62; but τοσοῦτʼ ἀπέχει τῶν χορηγῶν so far is it from the thoughts of . ., D. 21.59.

data.quote: τοσοῦτον ἀπέχω τοῦ ποιεῖν τι ὥστε . .

children.definition: to be far removed from, πολιτείας, μοναρχίας, Arist. Pol. 1289b2, 1293a17; τοῦ μέσου Id. EN 1109a10.
differ from, οὐδέν τι ἀπεῖχε γαμετῆς γυναικός Hdn. 1.16.4.
διαφύσιες . . ᾗσιν οὐδὲν ἀπέχει ἀγγεῖα εἶναι nothing is wanting, Hp. de Arte 10.

children.label: IV
children.definition: have or receive in full, τὴν ἀπόκρισιν Aeschin. 2.50; τὸ χρέος ἀ. receive payment in full, Call. Epigr. 55; χάριτας ib. 51; ἀπέχω in receipts, BGU 612.2 (i A.D.), etc.; ἀ. τὸν μισθόν Plu. Sol. 22, Ev.Matt. 6.2, al.; καρπὸν ἀ. τῶν πονηθέντων Plu. Them. 17; ἀ. τὸ μέτριον Id. Sanit. 2.124e.
ἀπέχει it sufficeth, it is enough, Ev.Marc. 14.41, cf. Anacreont. 15.33.
indigestion, etc.; διʼ ἀπεψίαν Arist. PA 668b8: in pl., Id. Mete. 381b9, Plu. Sanit. 2.127d, Gal. 8.34, S.E. P. 1.131.

definition: ἀπεωστόν ἀπόθητον, Hsch. ἀπηγενέες· ἀποτεταγμένοι, Id.
ἀπηγέομαι, ἀπήγημα, ἀπήγησις, Ion. for ἀφηγ-.

children.definition: defend oneself, like ἀπολογέομαι, Arist. Pr. 951a23:— Act., defend, Simp. in Cat. 17.2.
defence, opp. κατηγόρημα, Pl. Lg. 765b.

definition: ἀπηγορία, Dor. ἀπαγ-, ἡ, dub.l. in Pi. Fr. 122.6 (pl.).

children.definition: without rudder, Arist. IA 710a8.
strain off, filter, Ar. Ra. 943, Thphr. HP 9.8.3.
that which is filtered off, Asclep. ap. Gal. 14.142, Hippiatr. 6, 11.
one must strain off, Dsc. 5.88.

definition: ἀπήκει ἀπέχει, ἢ εἰς ὀξὺ συνάγει, Hsch. ἀπηκολλύρισεν· ἐν τῷ παραβεβλῆσθαι ἀπέστροφε ( Lacon.), Id.

children.definition: disobedient, opp. ὑπήκοος, Hsch.
exactly, Plu. Agis 2 (v.l.); sparingly, Alex. 213.4.
not capable of being solidified, Arist. Mete. 385b1, GA 735b30, HA 520a8.
not solid, θεμέλια Sor. 1.47.
neglect, A.R. 2.17.

without caring for anything, outright, bluntly, Hom. only in phrase μῦθον ἀπηλεγέως ἀποειπεῖν Il. 9.309, Od. 1.373; ἀ. πεπύθοιτο A.R. 4.1469; νίσσετʼ ἀπηλεγέως straightforwards, without looking about, Id. 1.785; sternly, 4.687; prob.f.l. for ἀνηλεγέως, Q.S. 1.226:—also ἀπηλεγές, Nic. Th. 495, Opp. C. 2.510. (From ἀλέγω, like νηλεγής, ἀνηλεγής.)
one who keeps away from the Ἡλιαία, i.e. an enemy to law, with a play on ἥλιος (not fond of basking in the sun), Ar. Av. 110.
become stupid, fatuous, Dsc. 5.17.

definition: ἀπηλιώτης (with or without ἄνεμος), ου, ὁ,

children.definition: east wind, Hdt. 4.22, 7.188, E. Cyc. 19, Th. 3.23; opp. ζέφυρος, Arist. Mete. 363b13, cf. Mu. 394b23, Vent. 973a13, al.—The Ion. form ἀπηλιώτης is retained in Att., and appears on the Tower of Andronicus Cyrrhestes, CIG 518; ἀφηλιώτης on a later table of the winds, IG 14.1308, and in Latin authors, Cat. 26.3, Seneca QN 5.16.4, Gell. 2.22.8.
from the quarter of the ἀπηλιώτης, Arist. Mete. 364a21, POxy. 985 (i A.D.), Ptol. Geog. 1.11.1.
apart from, ὀργῆς dub.l. in J. AJ 17.5.6.
unharmed, unhurt, Od. 19.282, cf. Hes. Th. 955; ἀ. βίοτος a life free from misery, Pi. O.8.87; ἔστω δʼ ἀπήμαντον be misery far away, A. Ag. 378 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., unharming, σθένος Id. Supp. 576 (lyr.); of snakes, Nic. Th. 492. Adv. -τως Tz.ad Lyc. 886.
carelessly, Procop. Vand. 1.4, al.
averter of ill, Ζεύς Paus. 1.32.2.
freedom from harm, safety, Thgn. 758, IG 12(5).215 ( Paros).
harmlessness, Opp. H. 2.647.

unharmed, unhurt, ἀδάκρυτος καὶ ἀ. Il. 1.415, al.; σὺν νηυσὶν ἀπήμονες ἦλθον Ἀχαιοί Od. 4.487; νόστος ἀ. ib. 519, cf. νῆες ἀπήμονες Opp. H. 5.676; ὄλβος, Pi. Pae. 9.8; μοῖρα A.R. 1.422; without sorrow or care, ἀ. κραδία κᾶδος ἀμφʼ ἀλλότριον Pi. N. 1.54, cf. P. 10.22: c.gen., ἀ. πάσης οἰζύος A. Eu. 893.— Rare in Prose, as Hdt. 1.42, 4.179, Pl. Phdr. 248c, Ph. 1.393.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., doing no harm: hence, kindly, propitious, οὖρον ἀπήμονά τε λιαρόν τε Od. 7.266, cf. 12.167; πόντος Hes. Op. 670; ὕπνον ἀπήμονά τε λιαρόν τε Il. 14.164; μῦθος 13.748; πομποί Od. 8.566; without hostile intent, A. Supp. 186; πλοῦς νεῶν ἀ. free from harm to them, E. IA 1575.
rudeness, discourtesy, Thphr. Char. 15.1: in pl., A.R. 2.1202.
stiffness, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.56, Sor. 1.44.
without wind, D.Chr. 6.33, AB 424; ἀ. λιμήν Poll. 1.100.

four-wheeled wagon, drawn by mules, ἡμίονοι ἕλκον τετράκυκλον ἀπήνην Il. 24.324, cf. Od. 6.57 with 69, 72, 73, 82; much the same as ἅμαξα, cf. Il. 24.266 with 324, Od. 6.72 with 73: of a racing-car, drawn by mules, ἡμιόνοις ξεστᾷ τʼ ἀπήνᾳ Pi. P. 4.94, cf. O. 5.3, Arist. Fr. 568; ἦν γὰρ δὴ ἀπήνη . . ἡμιόνους ἀνθʼ ἵππων ἔχουσα Paus. 5.9.2.

data.quote: ἦν γὰρ δὴ ἀπήνη . . ἡμιόνους ἀνθʼ ἵππων ἔχουσα

children.definition: car or chariot, A. Ag. 906, S. OT 753; ἀ. πωλική ib. 803; war-chariot, Str. 4.5.2; cf. καπάνα.
any conveyance, νατα ἀ. ship, E. Med. 1123; πλωταῖς ἀπήνῃσι Lyr.Adesp. 117 ( = Trag.Adesp. 142); τετραβάμονος ὡς ὑπʼ ἀπήνας, of the Trojan horse, E. Tr. 517 (lyr.).
pair, e.g. of brothers, ἀ. ὁμόπτερος Id. Ph. 329 (lyr.).
alae nasi, Poll. 2.80.

ungentle, rough, hard, of persons, Il. 1.340; ὅτι τοι νόος ἐστὶν ἀ. 16.35, cf. Od. 18.381; θυμὸς ὑπερφίαλος καὶ ἀ. Il. 15.94; μῦθον ἀπηνέα τε κρατερόν τε ib. 202, cf. Od. 18.381, al.; ὃς μὲν ἀπηνὴς αὐτὸς ἔη καὶ ἀπηνέα εἰδῇ cruel himself and full of cruel thoughts, 19.329.—Rare in Att. (never in Trag.), ὅπως τοῖς ἔξωθεν μηδὲν δείξειαν ἀπηνές Ar. Nu. 974 (anap.); ἀπηνές τι εἰπεῖν Pl. Phdr. 257b (but ἀπηχές (q.v.) Hermias ad loc.), cf. Lg. 950b, Call. Iamb. 1.257; freq. in later Prose, as Onos. 42.23, Phld. D. 3 Fr. 69, D.S. 9.24, Plu. QConv. 2.678b, Sollert. 970c, Luc. Nec. 18; τὸ ἐς ἀλλήλους ἀ. Procop. Goth. 4.35: Comp. -έστερος J. BJ 5.7.4, Adam. 2.44: Sup. -έστατος Ael. NA 3.26; τοῖς φίλοις J. BJ 1.24.8. Adv. -νῶς D.Chr. 32.53, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.19b; πρὸς φίλους ἀπηνῶς ζῆν ib. Cupid. 525d: Comp. -έστερον J. AJ 11.6.9.

data.quote: ὅπως τοῖς ἔξωθεν μηδὲν δείξειαν ἀπηνές

children.label: II
children.definition: σπλὴν ἀ. hard, Aret. SD 1.14, cf. 2.12; unpleasant to taste, CA 1.5. (Cf. προσ-ηνής, Goth. ansts ‘favour’.)

definition: ἀπῆνθον, Dor. aor. 2 of ἀπέρχομαι, Theoc. 2.84, al.

children.definition: harsh-minded, Sch. A. Pr. 159.
want of solidity, liability to flux, σώματος Ptol. Tetr. 204; incapacity for solidification, Ar.Byz. Epit. 15.9.
hanging, of branches, AP 9.71.
hanging on high, far distant, ἀστέρες οὔτε τι πολλὸν ἀ. οὔτε μάλʼ ἐγγύς Arat. 396: c. gen., ἀπάορος ἐχθρῶν aloof from them, Pi. P. 8.86.

data.quote: ἀστέρες οὔτε τι πολλὸν ἀ. οὔτε μάλʼ ἐγγύς

children.definition: take a thorough rest, Sor. 1.80, Orib. Fr. 74.
unharmed, A.R. 1.888 (ap. EM 122.4; ἀπήμοσιν codd.), v.l. A.R. 1.556 (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.7).
without scrotum, restored (for ἀπύρηνος) by Coraeës in Archestr. 8.9.
unmaimed, Hdt. 1.32, AP 7.110 ( D.L.), Hsch.
consistently with, τινί Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.105e.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. ἔχειν to be discontinuous, M.Ant. 4.45.
adequately, completely, D.H. 1.90; precisely, Procl. Hyp. 4.80.
intact, unimpaired, Thphr. CP 3.5.1, Gal. 5.234. Adv. -ωτί Theognost. Can. 159.

definition: ἀπηύρων, ας, α, v. sub ἀπούρας.

children.definition: discord, enmity, Lys. Fr. 88: ἀπηχία, Phryn. PS p.25B.
sound back, re-echo, Arist. Pr. 899a24, 918a35.
utter, φωνάς Arr. Epict. 2.17.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be out of tune, Phryn. PS p.25B., Suid.; to be discordant, Ph. 1.693, 2.44.
echo: metaph. of sayings repeated by rote, Pl. Ax. 366c; faint echo, τῆς ἐκεῖ ζωῆς Procl. in Alc. p.99C., cf. p.135C.
echo, ‘ring’, μεγαλοφροσύνης Longin. 9.2.
fracture from contre-coup, Sor. Fract. 8.
discordant, v.l. in Pl. Phdr. 257b (Hermias), cf. Aristid. Or. 40(5).8, Luc. Vit.Auct. 10; out of tune with oneʼs surroundings, Alciphr. 3.70.
echo: metaph. of posthumous fame, M.Ant. 4.3.
sounding, resonance, φωνῆς, πνεύματος, D.T. 629.26, Gal. 19.380, cf. Phlp. in Ph. 47.1 (pl.).
hostilely, Philostr. VA 7.36.
high in air, ἀ. δʼ ἔσαν ὄζοι Od. 12.435; cf. ἀπήορος.
of Apis, ἄρτοι PSI 4.425.40 (iii B. C.); cf. Ἀ. ἄρτος· Μεμφιτικός, Hsch.
Dor. for ἀποπέμπω, Th. 5.77; μεγάλου δʼ ἀπὸ χεῖρας ἴαλλε keep them off, Archestr. Fr. 29.
tear away, only in tmesi, ὁπόσων ἀπὸ θυμὸν ἴαπτε Q.S. 1.9.
not to be caught, Hsch. s.v. ἄναπτος.
wine flavoured with celery, Gp. 8.30, Alex.Trall.10.
pear-tree, Gp. 10.3.6 ( ἀππ- codd.).
Dim. of ἄπιον, pear, Sch. Od. 7.115 codd., Alex.Trall. 1.13.
the temple of Apis, OGI 90.33 ( Rosetta).
incompressible, Arist. Mete. 385a15, 386b8, Thphr. Lap. 8.
incredible, unlikely, Pl. Lg. 663e, Arist. Po. 1461b12; φαντασίαι Stoic. 2.25: Comp. ἔτι -ώτερον εἰ . . Str. 1.2.22.
not to be trusted or relied on, πρός τι in a matter, Aeschin. 2.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: unpersuaded, unconvinced, ἀ. ἂν εἴη Pl. Prm. 133c.

children.label: II
children.definition: not having confidence to do a thing, c. inf., Plu. Nic. 3.

children.label: III
children.definition: not persuasive, unconvincing, λόγος Pl. Phdr. 265b, cf. Arist. Rh. 1406b14, 1408b22; ὁρίζειν τὸν ἀριθμὸν ἀπίθανον Ael. Tact. 8.1; ἀ. λέγειν, of persons, Plu. Praec. 2.812e, cf. 819c; ἀ. ζωγράφος Luc. Ind. 22; ἀ. ἐν τῇ ὑποκρίσει Id. Pseudol. 16. Adv. -νως not persuasively, coarsely, rudely, Isoc. 5.26, D.H. Lys. 17, Epicur. Ep. 2p.35U., etc.
improbability, αἰτίας Aeschin. 2.64, J. Ap. 1.34.

definition: ἀπιθέω, ( πείθω) Ep. form of ἀπειθέω, c. dat., freq. in Hom. usu. with neg., οὐκ ἀπίθησε μύθῳ he

children.definition: disobeyed not the words, Il. 1.220, cf. 6.102, al.: abs., ib. 16.458: once c. gen., οὐδʼ ἀπίθησε θεὰ . . ἀγγελιάων h.Cer. 448: used in S. Ph. 1447 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: fail to persuade, οὐδʼ ἀπίθησέ νιν ( ϝιν Herm.) Pi. P. 4.36.
AP 5.86 ( Rufin.); for ἀπειθής II, lacking in persuasion, Timo 26.
pf. Pass., Hp. Fract. 7; of drawing lines, AP 6.67 ( Jul.Aegypt.); ἀ. τῆς ὄψιος τὰ διάστροφα Aret. CA 1.5.
winnow, σῖτον Thphr. CP 4.16.2.
not bitter, τῷ ἤθει Arist. VV 1250a42, cf. Ptol. Tetr. 158.
free from bitter bile, Hsch.
not to be pressed close, i.e. either incompressible or elastic, Arist. Mete. 385a17, 387a16.
exclude, Lys. 10.18 (nisi leg. ἀπείλλ-).
without fat, not fat, Diocl. Fr. 136, Arist. HA 519b8, PA 675b11, al.: Comp. -ώτερος ib. 672a23: Sup. -ώτατος HA 520a19.
without dirt, clean, Ath. 14.661d.
clean, Hsch. ( Pass.).
lack understanding, δοκέεις δέ μοι οὐκ ἀπινύσσειν Od. 5.342, 6.258; κῆρ ἀπινύσσων, of one lying senseless, Il. 15.10; cf. Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἀπινυτέω.
unwisely, Hsch. s.v. ἀπινύσσων.

definition: ἄπιξις, εως, ἡ, Ion. for ἄφιξις.

children.definition: φύλλα like those of the pear-tree, Thphr. HP 3.10.3, cf. Gal. 19.137.
pear, Pl. Lg. 845b, Theoc. 7.120, Thphr. CP 6.14.4.
pear-tree, ib. 1.15.2.
pear-tree, Pyrus communis, Arist. HA 552b2, Thphr. HP 1.3.3, CP 1.15.2, Dsc. 1.116, Gal. 11.834.
pear, Ar. Fr. 569.3; ἀπʼ Εὐβοίας ἀπίους Hermipp. 63.17, Alex. 33, Gal. 6.603.

children.label: II
children.definition: Euphorbia Apios, tuberous spurge, Thphr. HP 9.9.5, Dsc. 4.175.
far away, far off, distant, τηλόθεν ἐξ ἀπίης γαίης Il. 1.270, 3.49, Od. 16.18, cf. S. OC 1685.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἄπιος, α, ον, Apian, i.e. Peloponnesian, said (in this sense) to be derived from Ἆπις, Apis, a mythical king of Argos, A. Supp. 260, cf. Paus. 2.5.7; Ἀπία γῆ, Ἀπία χθών, or Ἀπία alone, the Peloponnese, esp. Argolis, A. Ag. 256, S. OC 1303, Ath. 14.650b, etc.; cf. Ἀπίς prob. in A.R. 4.1564. [The former word has ᾰ, the latter ᾱ; yet S. OC 1685 uses signf. I with ᾱ, and later Ep. Poets have signf. II with ᾰ, cf. Rhian. 13.] (Commonly derived from ἀπό, as ἀντίος from ἀντί; and Hsch. expl. ἐξ ἀπίης γαίης by ἀλλοτρίας ἢ ξένης ἢ μακρὰν οὔσης, cf. Str. 8.6.9.)
press the juice from anything, Hdt. 2.94.

definition: Ἆπις, ιδος, εως, and Ion. ιος, ὁ,

children.definition: Apis, a bull worshipped in Egypt, Hdt. 2.153, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἀπίς, = Ἀπία γῆ, Theoc. 25.183, prob. in A.R. 4.1564.

make equal, αὑτὸν ἀ. τοῖς κλιντῆρσιν, in reference to Procrustes, Plu. Thes. 11, cf. Luc. Pr.Im. 13:— Pass., to be made equal, τῇ ἀξίῃ τῶν φορτίων to their value, Hdt. 4.196, cf. Sch. Il. Oxy. 1086i 22 (in form ἀφ-).
unpitched, ἄγγη Str. 11.10.2, cf. Dsc. 1.71 (interpol.).

definition: ἀπιστεύω, incorrect form for sq., ἀ. εἰ . . POxy. 237v5 (ii A.D.).
ἀπιστέω, fut. Pass. ἀπιστηθήσομαι D.S. 32.10, but ἀπιστήσομαι in pass. sense, Pl. R. 450c:—

children.definition: to be ἄπιστος, and so:

children.label: I
children.definition: disbelieve, distrust, ἐγὼ τὸ μὲν οὔ ποτʼ ἀπίστεον Od. 13.339; τύχην ἀ. E. Alc. 1130; πάντα Ar. Ec. 775, cf. Th. 7.28 (s.v.l.), X. Ages. 5.6, 8.7:— Pass., τὴν γνῶσιν τοῦ οἰκείου ἀπιστεῖσθαι was distrusted, i.e. no one could be sure of knowing, Th. 7.44; ἀ. ἐν μαρτυρίαις Antipho 2.2.7; ἐπειδὰν γνῶσιν ἀπιστούμενοι, οὐ φιλοῦσι τοὺς ἀπιστοῦντας X. Cyr. 7.2.17, cf. Hier. 4.1; ὑπὸ τῆς πατρίδος Id. Smp. 4.29, cf. Pl. Plt. 271b, Isoc. 5.49:—but mostly,

data.quote: ἐγὼ τὸ μὲν οὔ ποτʼ ἀπίστεον
ἐπειδὰν γνῶσιν ἀπιστούμενοι, οὐ φιλοῦσι τοὺς ἀπιστοῦντας

children.definition: κρατέουσιν Emp. 5.1, cf. Th. 8.83, Pl. Prt. 319b, etc.: so c. dat. rei, τῷ χρησμῷ Hdt. 1.158; πῶς ἀπιστήσω λόγοις; S. Ph. 1350, cf. Th. 6.86; ἀ.τῇ ἐξ αὑτῶν ξυνέσει Id. 3.37; τοῖς ἰάμασιν IG 4.951.24 (Epid.); ἡμῖν αὐτοῖς Arist. EN 1112b10; ἀ.τινί τι disbelieve one in a thing, Hdt. 3.122; περί τινος Id. 4.96; οἷς ἠπίστησαν ἔχειν . . whom they suspected of having, Plb. 4.18.8.

inf., οὐδέν σʼ ἀπιστῶ καὶ δὶς οἰμῶξαι I nothing doubt that . ., S. Aj. 940; ἀ. μὴ γενέσθαι τι to doubt that it could be, Th. 1.10; ἀπιστοῦντες αὐτὸν μὴ ἥξειν Id. 2.101, cf. 4.40, Pl. Plt. 301c, R. 555a; also ἀ. μὴ οὐκ ἐπιστήμη ᾖ ἡ ἀρετή Id. Men. 89d; ἀ. πῶς . . Phd. 73b; ἀ. εἰ . . APl. 16.52 ( Phil.), Ph. 2.555; ὅτι . . Pl. Men. 89d; ὡς R. 450c:— Pass., τὸ ἐπιτήδευμα ἀπιστεῖται μὴ δυνατὸν εἶναι it is not believed to be possible, Id. Lg. 839c, cf. Chrm. 168e.

data.quote: ἀ. μὴ οὐκ ἐπιστήμη ᾖ ἡ ἀρετή

children.definition: to be incredulous, Hdt. 8.94, cf. Ev.Marc. 16.16, etc.; νᾶφε καὶ μέμνασʼ ἀπιστεῖν Epich. 250; ἐπὶ τοῖς λεγομένοις Ph. 2.92.

children.label: II
children.definition: disobey, τινί Hdt. 6.108, freq. in Trag. and Pl., A. Pr. 640, S. Ant. 381 (lyr.), Tr. 1183, 1224, Pl. Ap. 29c, al.: abs., to be disobedient, τοῖς ἀπιστοῦσιν τάδε in these things, S. Ant. 219, cf. 656; ἢν δʼ ἀπιστῶσι but if they refuse to comply, E. Supp. 389, cf. Pl. Lg. 941c.
to be faithless, εἰ ἡμεῖς ἀπιστοῦμεν, ἐκεῖνος πιστὸς μένει 2 Ep.Tim. 2.13.

data.quote: εἰ ἡμεῖς ἀπιστοῦμεν, ἐκεῖνος πιστὸς μένει

children.definition: νεκρὸς τὸν θάνατον ἀπιστούμενος belying death, Polem. Call. 55.

children.label: III
children.definition: τὸ σῶμʼ οὐκ ἀπιστήσω χθονί, i.e. I will not hesitate to commit it . ., E. Heracl. 1024; τούτῳ ἠπίστησεν ἀποθανοῦσαν ἑαυτὴν ἐπιτρέψαι Lys. 31.21.
one must mistrust, disbelieve, c. dat., Plb. 4.41.8; of persons, Str. 8.4.10, etc.; ἀ. ἡμῖν περί . . Hp. Cord. 2.
incredulous, M.Ant. 1.6.

unbelief, distrust, πίστεις . . δμῶς καὶ ἀπιστίαι ὤλεσαν ἄνδρας beliefs and disbeliefs, Hes. Op. 372; πίστει χρήματʼ ὄλεσσα, ἀπιστίῃ δʼ ἐσάωσα Thgn. 831 [ ῑ]; τῶν θείων τὰ πολλὰ ἀπιστίῃ διαφυγγάνει μὴ γινώσκεσθαι Heraclit. 86, cf. Pl. Grg. 493c; τοῖσι παρεοῦσι ἀ. πολλὴ ὑπεκέχυτο Hdt. 3.66, cf. 2.152; ὑπὸ ἀπιστίης Id. 3.153, al.; ὑπὸ ἀ. μὴ γενέσθαι τι from disbelief that . ., Id. 1.68; ἀ. πρὸς ἑαυτόν lack of self- confidence, Th. 8.66; ἀπιστίᾳ λόγους ἐνδέχεσθαι E. Ion 1606; πέφευγε τοὔπος ἐξ ἀπιστίας A. Ag. 268; ἀπιστίαν ἔχειν περί τινος to be in doubt, Pl. Phd. 107b; σώφρων ἀ. E. Hel. 1617; πρὸς -ίαν τοῦ κατηγόρου to discredit him, Arist. Rh. 1398a10; ἡ ἀ. ἡ πρὸς ἀλλήλους Id. Pol. 1297a4; ἀ. ἡ καθʼ αὑτοῦ Longin. 38.2; πρός τι Pl. Sph. 258c.

data.quote: πίστει χρήματʼ ὄλεσσα, ἀπιστίῃ δʼ ἐσάωσα
ῑ]; τῶν θείων τὰ πολλὰ ἀπιστίῃ διαφυγγάνει μὴ γινώσκεσθαι

children.definition: τὰ εἰρημένα ἐς ἀ. πολλὴν ἀπῖκται Hdt. 1.193; πολλὰς ἀπιστίας ἔχει it admits of many doubts, Pl. R. 450c; ὁ λόγος εἰς ἀ. καταπίπτει Id. Phd. 88d; καταβαλεῖν τινὰ εἰς ἀ. ib.c; ἀ. παρέχειν ib. 86e (interpol.); ἀτοπία καὶ ἀπιστία incredibility, Isoc. 17.48; ταῦτʼ ἀπιστίαν ἔχει D. 10.44.

data.quote: τὰ εἰρημένα ἐς ἀ. πολλὴν ἀπῖκται

children.label: II
children.definition: want of faith, faithlessness, θνήσκει δὲ πίστις βλαστάνει δʼ ἀ. S. OC 611; treachery, And. 3.2, X. An. 2.5.21; βλέπειν ἀπιστίαν Eup. 309.

data.quote: θνήσκει δὲ πίστις βλαστάνει δʼ ἀ.

children.label: I
children.definition: Pass., not to be trusted, and so:

not trusty, faithless, ὑπερφίαλοι καὶ ἄ. Il. 3.106; θεοῖσίν τʼ ἐχθρὲ καὶ ἀνθρώποισιν ἄπιστε Thgn. 601; ἄ. ὡς γυναικεῖον γένος E. IT 1298; ἄ. ληίστορες Sammelb. 4309.14 (iii B.C.); δολοπλοκίαι Thgn. 226; ἄ. ποιεῖν τινά mistrusted, Hdt. 8.22, cf. 9.98; τὰ ἑαυτοῦ πιστὰ ἀ. ποιεῖν X. An. 2.4.7; ἄπιστος ἑταιρείας λιμήν S. Aj. 683; θράσει ἀ. ἐπαιρόμενος by untrustworthy, groundless confidence, Th. 1.120; shifty, unreliable, Pl. Lg. 775d.

data.quote: θεοῖσίν τʼ ἐχθρὲ καὶ ἀνθρώποισιν ἄπιστε

children.definition: incredible, dub. in Archil. 74.5, cf. Pi. O. 1.31, Hdt. 3.80; τέρας A. Pr. 832; ἄ. καὶ πέρα κλύειν Ar. Av. 418; ἄ. ἐνόμιζον εἰ . . Ph. 2.556; τὸ ἐλπίδων ἄ. undreamed of even in hope, S. Ph. 868: Comp. -ότερος, λόγος Aeschin. 3.59: Sup., πίστις ἀπιστοτάτη And. 1.67, cf. Pl. Ep. 314b.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., mistrustful, incredulous, suspicious, θυμὸς δέ τοι αἰὲν ἄ. Od. 14.150; ὦτα . . ἀπιστότερα ὀφθαλμῶν less credulous, Hdt. 1.8; ἄ. πρὸς Φίλιππον distrustful towards him, D. 19.27; ἄ. εἶ . . σαυτῷ you do not believe what you say yourself, Pl. Ap. 26e; ἤθη ἄ. Id. Lg. 705a; τὸ ἄ., = ἀπιστία, Th. 8.66; δούλοις πῶς οὐκ ἄπιστον; Gorg. Pal. 11.

children.label: b
children.definition: NT, unbelieving, 1 Ep.Cor. 6.6, al.
disobedient, disloyal, S. Fr. 627: c. gen., A. Th. 876; ἔχειν ἄπιστον . . ἀναρχίαν πόλει, i.e. ἀναρχίαν ἔχειν ἀπειθοῦσαν τῇ πόλει, ib. 1035, cf. E. IT 1476.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. ἀπίστως:
Pass., beyond belief, ἀ. ἐπὶ τὸ μυθῶδες ἐκνενικηκότα Th. 1.21; οὐκ ἀ. not incredibly, Arist. Rh.Al. 1438a22, 1438b2.
Act., distrustfully, suspiciously, Th. 3.83; ἀ. τινὰ διαθεῖναι D. 20.22.

children.label: b
children.definition: treacherously, Ph. 1.516.
E. Med. 422 (lyr.).
Numen. ap. Eus. PE 14.7.
loving unbelief, Orac. ap. Phleg. Mir. 10.
make lean or thin, Philem. 98.7, Arist. HA 574b6.
one must make thin, Arist. Pr. 865a37.
shrink, Hp. Int. 3, Morb.Sacr. 8, cf. Sor. 1.53.
oppose firmly, give a flat denial, πρός τινα Th. 1.140, cf. Plu. Per. 31; πρὸς τὰς ἡδονάς Id. Agis 4, al.; hold out against, πρὸς δίψος Them. Or. 11.149c.

children.label: II
children.definition: set oneself to affirm, maintain a thing, ib. 28.342c, Eust. 1278.53, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: cling firmly, of the λεπάς, Sch. Ar. Pl. 1096.
positively, Eust. 1861.41.
keep off, hold off, Od. 11.95; χεῖρας ἔργου J. BJ 1.7.3.
equalization, Nicom. Ar. 1.23; as a rhetorical figure, coupled with παρίσωσις, Poll. 4.27 (pl.).
one must go away, Hp. Ep. 13, X. An. 5.3.1, Amphis 1, Luc. Herm. 82.
unwatered, BCH 21.554 (Thesp.); cf. πιτεύω.
perry, Dsc. 5.24, Gp. 8.5 ( ἀππ-).
Luc. Lex. 2.
to become a fish, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69.
eating no fish, Ar. Fr. 564 ( = E. Fr. 366).
Subst., paltry little fish, Eust. 1720.24.
not fat, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 4.120e, Aret. CD 1.5.
not obliquely, Eust. 1229.41.

definition: ἀπλακέω, ἀπλακία, etc., v. sub ἀμπλακέω, etc.

children.definition: without cakes, Pl.Com. 113.
constancy, unchangeableness, Suid.
not wandering, steady, fixed, Pl. Plt. 288a, al.: c. gen., ἀπλανὲς ἀπηργάσατο ἐκείνων [κινήσεων] made it free from their influence, Id. Ti. 34a.
fixed, opp. planets, ib. 40b, cf. Arist. Mete. 343b9, Metaph. 1073b10, Arat. 461, AP 9.25 ( Leon.); ἡ ἀ. σφαῖρα Corp.Herm. 2.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: straight, AP 6.65 ( Paul.Sil.).

children.label: III
children.definition: unwavering, θεωρία Epicur. Ep. 3p.62U.
not erring, S.E. M 7.195, Longin. 2.2 ( Sup.), etc. Adv. -νῶς without going astray, Max.Tyr. 5.2; accurately, Alciphr. 3.59.
freedom from error, S.E. M. 7.394.
that cannot go astray or err, LXX Jb. 12.20, Babr. 50.20, POxy. 237 vi30 (ii A. D.).
sincerity, Pl. Def. 412e.
not capable of being moulded, Arist. Mete. 385a15.

not moulded: hence, natural, unaffected, φρόνημα, εὔνοια, προθυμία, ἦθος, etc., Plu. Aem. 37, Vit.Philonid. p.10 C., Them. Or. 4.56d, etc.; of persons, LXX Ge. 25.27, Ceb. 20. Adv. -τως naturally, without disguise, γελᾶν Pl. Ep. 319b codd.; αὐλεῖν Thphr. HP 4.11.4; λέγειν D.H. Rh. 10.11; ἀποκρίνεσθαι Ael. VH 9.27.
not feigned: hence, true, opp. mythical, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.16c, Adul. 62c.
not fully shapen, unformed, Ph. 2.317.
without breadth, γραμμή Arist. APr. 49b36; μῆκος ἀ., opp. πλάτος ἔχον, Id. Top. 143b14: metaph., Gal. 7.410; ἀ. ὑγίεια without latitude, i.e. variation, Id. 6.28. Adv. -τῶς Iamb. in Nic. p.56P.

definition: ἄπλατος, Dor. and Trag. for Ep. ἄπλητος (q.v.), ον, ( πελάζω)

children.definition: unapproachable, always with a notion of terrible, monstrous, Hes. Op. 148, Th. 151; ἄ. πῦρ Pi. P. 1.21 (whence it must be restored for ἀπλήστου in A. Pr. 373); ὀφίων κεφαλαί, Τυφών, Pi. P. 12.9, Fr. 93; Ἔχιδνα B. 5.62, cf. 12.51; θρέμμα S. Tr. 1093; αἶσα Id. Aj. 256 (lyr.); ἄπλατον ἀξύμβλητον ἐξεθρεψάμην Id. Fr. 387.—In many places ἄπλαστος is a v.l., Id. Aj. 256, E. Med. 151 (lyr.); cf. ἄπληστος.
Com.Adesp. 620; ἄπλατοι ὅσοι Phld. Rh. 1.3S., al.; γάλα Diog.Oen. 39, cf. Epicur. Nat. 11.154.14, Phld. Oec. p.41 J., Porph. Abst. 1.55; cf. ἄπλητος.
unplaited, χαιτη AP 7.412 ( Alc. Mess.), Epigr.Gr. 790.8 ( Dyme).
without an extra letter, Eust. 947.16.
free from avarice, Chaerem. ap. Porph. Abst. 4.6.
without excess, Theol.Ar. 34.
unapproachably great, λίθος Sch. A.R. 3.41.

boundless, immense, ἠέρος ὕψος Emp. 17.18; αὐγή Id. 135; δόξα Pi. I. 4(3).11; βάρος S. Tr. 982; also found in Prose, χρυσὸς ἄ. Hdt. 1.14, 50, al.; ἅλες, ὕδωρ, 4.53, 8.12; οἰμωγή 6.58; μάχη Pl. Sph. 246c; ἄ. καὶ ἀμήχανον [χρόνου πλῆθος] Id. Lg. 676b; ἐν χρόνου μήκεσιν ἀπλέτοις ib. 683a; χιών X. An. 4.4.11; πλῆθος Arist. GA 755b26; ποταμοὶ ἄπλετοι τὸ μέγεθος Id. Mete. 355b23; ῥαφανίδες ἄ. τὸ πάχος Id. Pr. 924a27; θόρυβος Plb. 1.50.3, al.; φύσις Plot. 5.5.6; δύναμις 4.8.6.
without sides or ribs, ἄ. στῆθος narrow chest, Arist. Phgn. 810a3, cf. 809b7 ( Comp.); of persons, narrow-chested, opp. εὔπλευροι, ib. 810b13, Teles p. 55.3 H., Mnesith. ap. Orib. 21.7.6 ( Sup.).
not navigated: τὸ ἄ. part of the sea not yet navigated, X. Cyr. 6.1.16.
free from metrical defect, Diom. p.498 K.
clad in a single garment: generally, = ἁπλοῦς, Eup. 222.
Subst.), a single upper garment or cloak, opp. διπληγίς, S. Fr. 777, Ar. Fr. 54, Herod. 5.18.
not smitten with disease, etc., PMag.Par. 1.1063.
not multiplied, without plurality, Porph. Sent. 33, Procl. in Prm. p.535 S. Adv. -τως Porph. Sent. 1.c., Procl. Inst. 62.

unstricken, of a horse needing no whip or spur, Eup. 232, Pl. Phdr. 253d: metaph., Plu. QConv. 2.721e; unwounded, without receiving a blow, φροῦδοι δʼ ἄ. E. Rh. 814; immune from stings, Dsc. 2.118; of a plant, uninjured, Thphr. HP 9.14.1.
Act., not striking, in Adv. -τως without pulsation, Procl. in Cra. p.37P.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not irritating or pungent, Sor. 2.59: Comp., not too stimulating, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 5.116. Adv. -τως Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.24.53.
without discord, Dam. Pr. 434.
Hsch.
Arr. Epict. 4.1.124; sens. obsc., Luc. Am. 54.
insatiable, Phld. Mus. p.78K., Ph. 2.266, al., Luc. Merc.Cond. 39; Ἁιδης IG 14.1754; πάντων Plu. Cupid. 2.524b; unsatisfied, Gal. 17(1).597.
unfilled, Poll. 1.121; τὸ ἀ. absence of satiety, Plot. 5.8.4.

definition: ἀπληστεί, Adv. of ἄπληστος, Hdn. Epim. 257.

children.definition: to be insatiable, τινός in a thing, Hipparch. ap. Stob. 4.44.81; ἔν τινι LXX Si. 34(31).17.

insatiate desire, greediness, whether of food or money, ὑπὸ τῆς ἀπληστίας Pherecr. 156; εἰς τοσαύτην ἀ. ἀφίκοντο Lys. 12.19, cf. D. 36.44; διὰ τὴν ἀ. Pl. Grg. 493b; ἀ. τρόπων D. 22.67 (interpol.); γαστρός Ph. 1.360.
insatiate desire of, πλούτου, χρυσοῦ, Pl. R. 562b, Lg. 831d; λέχους E. Andr. 218; τῆς εὐχῆς, referring to Midas, Arist. Pol. 1257b16; τοῦ θεωρεῖν Ph. 1.12.
insatiate in wine, ἀρύταιναι Timo 4 [778].
insatiate, greedy, Thgn. 109, S. El. 1336, Arist. HA 591b2, etc.; sts. confounded with ἄπλαστος (i.e. ἄπλατος), q.v.
ἄ. χρημάτων, αἵματος, Hdt. 1.187, 212, Pl. Lg. 773e, etc.; κακῶν A. Eu. 976 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -τως, ἔχειν Pl. Grg. 493c, al.; ἀ. διακεῖσθαι or ἔχειν πρός τι X. Cyr. 4.1.14, Isoc. 5.135, 8.7: also neut. pl. as Adv., αἰάξας ἄπληστα CIG 2240 ( Chios).
Ep. and Ion. form of ἄπλᾱτος (q.v.), ον, dub. in h.Cer. 83; μαίνεται ἄπλητον Semon. 7.34; = ἄπλετος, great, χεύματα Orph. A. 1051; αἰθήρ Q.S. 8.222; δῶρα Id. 9.510.
throw at dice, Poll. 7.204.
camp-prison, PLond. ined. 2487 (iv A.D.):—hence ἀπλικιτ-άριοι, οἱ, warders, Lyd. Mag. 3.8.

definition: ἁπλοδίσημος, ον, (also written ἁπλοτίσ-) dub.sens., ἔργον, apptly. of embroidery or weaving, PLond.ined. 2132.

children.definition: simple or single, Theol.Ar. 52 ( Comp.).
with plain hair, Ptol. Tetr. 143, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.2.

definition: ἄπλοια, ἡ, Ion. and poet. ἀπλοΐη, Call. Dian. 230, prob. in AP 7.640 ( Antip.). ἄπλους):—

children.definition: impossibility of sailing, detention in port, esp. from stress of weather, A. Ag. 188; ἀπλοίᾳ χρῆσθαι E. IA 88, cf. IT 15; ἡσύχαζεν ὑπὸ ἀπλοίας Th. 4.4, cf. 6.22: pl., ἀποπλέειν . . ὁρμημένον αὐτὸν ἶσχον ἄπλοιαι Hdt. 2.119.

definition: ἁπλοΐδιον, τό, Dim. of ἁπλοΐς, PPetr. 3p.18 (iii B.C.).

children.definition: behave simply, deal frankly, πρὸς τοὺς φίλους X. Mem. 4.2.18; to be simple in habits, D.C. 65.7; to be reduced to simplicity, Dam. Pr. 32.— Act. in same sense, Sch. Od. 6.187.

simple, natural, plain, Phint. ap. Stob. 4.23.61a, Luc. Tim. 56, A.D. Synt. 200.18, Hermog. Id. 2.9, Demetr. Eloc. 244, etc.: Comp. -ώτερος Simp. in Ph. 337.11: Sup. -ώτατος Philostr. VS 2.9.2, Luc. Alex. 4. Adv. -κῶς D.H. Dem. 45.

definition: ἄπλοιοι οἱ μὴ δυνάμενοι πλεῖν, Hsch.

children.definition: simple, single, ἁπλοΐδες χλαῖναι Il. 24.230, Od. 24.276: as Subst., single garment, = ἁπληγίς, AP 5.293 ( Agath.).
having shorn her hair, AP 7.146 ( Antip. Sid.).
Opp. H. 3.469: metaph., unconnected, cj. in Longin. 19.1.
a Cynic who wore his coat single instead of double, Plu. Brut. 34, D.L. 6.13.

definition: ἁπλόος, η, ον, contr. ἁπλοῦς, ῆ, οῦν, opp. διπλόος

children.definition: twofold, and so,

children.label: I
children.definition: single, ἁπλῆ γὰρ οἶμος εἰς Ἁιδου φέρει A. Fr. 239, cf. X. Cyr. 1.3.4 ( Comp.); ἁπλῷ τείχει περιτειχίζειν Th. 3.18; δὶς τόσʼ ἐξ ἁπλῶν κακά S. Aj. 277; ὅπως ἂν ἡ χάρις ἐξ ἁπλῆς διπλῆ φανῇ Id. Tr. 619; ἁπλᾶς δὲ λύπας ἐξὸν οὐκ οἴσω διπλᾶς E. IT 688.

data.quote: ἁπλῆ γὰρ οἶμος εἰς Ἁιδου φέρει
ὅπως ἂν ἡ χάρις ἐξ ἁπλῆς διπλῆ φανῇ
ἁπλᾶς δὲ λύπας ἐξὸν οὐκ οἴσω διπλᾶς

children.label: b
children.definition: ἁπλαῖ (sc. κρηπῖδες), αἱ, single-soled shoes, Stratt. 24, D. 54.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: simple, plain, straightforward, κελεύθοις ἁπλόαις ζωᾶς Pi. N. 8.36; ἁ. ὁ μῦθος A. Ch. 554; ἁ. λόγῳ Id. Pr. 610, al.; ὡς ἁ. λόγῳ ib. 46, Ar. Ach. 1151; ἁ. λόγος the matter is simple, E. Hel. 979; ἁ. διήγησις simple narrative (without dialogue), Pl. R. 392d; οὐκ ἐς ἁπλοῦν φέρει leads to no simple issue, S. OT 519; ἁπλᾶ γε καὶ σαφῆ λέγω μαθεῖν Alex. 240.7; οὐδὲν ἔχω ἁπλούστερον λέγειν X. Cyr. 3.1.32; of single-membered periods, Demetr. Eloc. 17, etc.; of habits, ἁπλούστατος βίος Plb. 9.10.5; νόμοι λίαν ἁ. καὶ βαρβαρικοί Arist. Pol. 1268b39; ἁπλοῦν ἦν . . ἀποθανεῖν a plain course, Men. 14.

data.quote: ἁπλᾶ γε καὶ σαφῆ λέγω μαθεῖν

children.label: b
children.definition: simple, open, frank, ἁπλᾶ γάρ ἐστι τῆς ἀληθείας ἔπη A. Fr. 176; ἁ. καὶ γενναῖος Pl. R. 361b, etc.; ἁ. τρόποι E. IA 927; opp. δόλος, Ar. Pl. 1158; πρὸς τοὺς φίλους ὡς ἁπλούστατον εἶναι X. Mem. 4.2.16.

data.quote: ἁπλᾶ γάρ ἐστι τῆς ἀληθείας ἔπη
πρὸς τοὺς φίλους ὡς ἁπλούστατον εἶναι

children.label: c
children.definition: simple-minded, ὁ κριτὴς ὑπόκειται εἶναι ἁ. Arist. Rh. 1357a12, cf. HA 608b4 ( Comp.), Rh. 1367a37; in bad sense, simple, silly, Isoc. 2.46; λίαν γὰρ ἁπλοῦν τὸ νομίζειν . . Arist. Mete. 339b34.

children.label: III
children.definition: simple, opp. compound or mixed, Pl. R. 547e, etc.; opp. μεμιγμένος, κεκραμένος, Arist. Metaph. 989b17, Sens. 447a18; ἁ. χρώματα Id. Col. 791a1; ἁ. ὀνόματα, opp. διπλᾶ, Id. Po. 1457a31; also of nouns, without the article, A.D. Synt. 98.17, al.; of the positive adjective, Plu. Def.orac. 2.412e, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἁ. βιβλία rolls containing a single author, Id. Ant. 58.

children.label: c
children.definition: unalloyed, pure, SIG 901.9 ( Delph., iv A. D.), PCair. 67041.

children.label: d
children.definition: ἁ. ἐπίδεσμος, a kind of bandage, Hp. Off. 7, etc.
absolute, sheer, ἀκρασία Arist. EN 1149a2; συμφορά Lys. 24.8, etc.
simple, unqualified (cf. ἁπλῶς II.3), οὐ πάνυ μοι δοκεῖ . . οὕτως ἁπλοῦν εἶναι ὥστε . . Pl. Prt. 331b, cf. Smp. 206a, Tht. 188d, al.

data.quote: οὐ πάνυ μοι δοκεῖ . . οὕτως ἁπλοῦν εἶναι ὥστε . .

children.definition: general, opp. ἀκριβής, Arist. Metaph. 1025b7 ( Comp.), cf. 1030a16.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Adv. ἁπλῶς, v. sub voc.

children.label: V
children.definition: Comp. and Sup. ἁπλούστερος, ἁπλούστατος, v. supr.; irreg. Sup. ἁπλότατος AP 6.185 ( Zos.). (Cf. δι-πλόος; ἁ- = sṃ; -πλόος perh. identical with πλοῦς ‘voyage’, cf. Serb. jedan put ( ‘one journey, hence) onceʼ; transition from ‘once’ to ‘simple’ as in Lett. vienkaršs ‘simple’ (cf. Lith. vienkart ‘onceʼ).)

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., of ships, unseaworthy, τριήρεις And. 3.5; ναῦς ἄπλους ποιεῖν Th. 7.34; νῆες ἅπλοι ἐγένοντο ibid.: of persons, ναύκληρον . . ποιήσας ἄπλουν Crito Com. 3: Comp., ἀπλοώτεραι νῆες less fit for sea, Th. 7.60 (codd.; ἀπλούστεραι Suid.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., of the sea, not navigable, closed to navigation (cf. ἄπλοια) , ἄπλους ἡ θάλαττα ὑπὸ τῶν . . λῃστῶν γέγονεν D. 18.241; ἅλμη A.R. 4.1271; Πόντος Plb. 4.38.7: metaph., αἰθήρ Nonn. D. 6.358.

data.quote: ἄπλους ἡ θάλαττα ὑπὸ τῶν . . λῃστῶν γέγονεν

children.label: III
children.definition: no seafarer, Ἠχώ ib. 319.
simply passive, S.E. P. 3.108 ( ἁπλο-πάθεια, ἡ, is f.l. ib. 47).

definition: ἁπλός, ή, όν, late form for ἁπλόος, An.Ox. 2.331.

children.definition: LXX Jb. 21.23.
of simple form, Str. Chr. 2.28.
singleness, τῆς φωνῆς Arist. Aud. 801a19.

children.label: II
children.definition: simplicity, πόλεως X. HG 6.1.18; κατὰ τὴν μουσικήν Pl. R. 404e; τῆς τροφῆς D.S. 3.17: of literarystyle, D.H. Rh. 9.14: pl., ἁπλότητες λόγων ibid.
simplicity, frankness, sincerity, X. Cyr. 1.4.3, LXX Wi. 1.1, Plb. 1.78.8, D.S. 5.66, etc.; ἡ εἰς τὸν Χριστὸν ἁ. 2 Ep.Cor. 11.3.
open-heartedness: hence, liberality, ib. 8.2, 9.11, cf. IG 14.1517.
cut by a simple incision, τι Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.8.1:— Pass., Aët. 8.26:—hence ἁπλο-τομητέον, Id. 16.123.
simple incision, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.8.6, Gal. 14.781.
Pl. Cra. 405c, IG 9(2).512.19 ( Larissa), etc.
without riches, S. Fr. 835; ἁβρὸς καὶ οὐκ ἄ. Philostr. VA 6.36; ἄ. ἀπεργάσασθαι τὸν πλοῦτον Thphr. Fr. 78.
Dsc. 3.91 (prob.l.).

make single, unfold, spread out, οὐρήν Batr. 74 (v. l.), cf. 80; σῶμα AP 11.107 ( Lucill.); ἱστία Orph. A. 360, etc.; σαγήνην Alciphr. 3.3; φάλαγγα Paus. 4.11.2; δακτύλους Sor. 1.73; ἁ. τὸν ἄργυρον beat it thin, Anacreont. 4.5; expose a wound, Just. Nov. 111 Pr.:— Pass., ἀγρευθεὶς εἰς τὸ πλοῖον ἡπλώθη [the fish] lay stretched out . ., Babr. 4.5; ἀσπάραγος χαίρει γῇ ἡπλωμένῃ open ground, Gp. 12.18.1; ἁπλωθέντων ἱστίων Lib. Or. 11.264:— Med., AP 10.9, Orph. A. 278, D.P. 235.
ἅπλωσον σεαυτόν be simple, M.Ant. 4.26:— Pass., to be simplified, Plot. 6.7.35; but, to be expanded, Id. 3.5.9 (fort. ἐξαπλ-).
make plain, ὁδόν LXX Jb. 22.3.
filthiness, filth, AP 7.377 ( Eryc.).
sponge, so called because it cannot be cleaned, Arist. HA 549a4, Plin. HN 9.150, prob.l. in Thphr. HP 4.6.10.

unwashen, unwashed, of clothes, ἄλουτος ἀπλύτοις ἐν εἵμασιν Semon. 7.5; ῥαφανίδες Eup. 312, cf. Pherecr. 175; of sponges, Arist. HA 548b29; of parts of the body, Ar. V. 1035; ἀ. ποσὶ διεξιέναι τὰ φανερώτατα D.Chr. 12.43; ἄ. ἄρτος Gal. 6.500. Adv. -τως, λοιδορεῖν with foul language, Phld. Ir. p.45 W.
that which is unfolded, expanse, Sch. Ar. Av. 1218.

singly, in one way, μένειν ἁ. ἐν τῇ αὑτοῦ μορφῇ Pl. R. 381c, etc.; ἁ. λέγεσθαι in one sense, opp. πολλαχῶς, Arist. Top. 158b10; ἁ. λεγόμενα, opp. συμπλεκόμενα, Id. Metaph. 1014a19, cf. Ph. 195b15; opp. κατʼ ἀλλήλων λέγεσθαι, without distinction of subject and predicate, Metaph. 1041b1; ἐσθλοὶ μὲν γὰρ ἁ. παντοδαπῶς δὲ κακοί Poët. ap. EN 1106b35, etc.

data.quote: μένειν ἁ. ἐν τῇ αὑτοῦ μορφῇ

children.label: II
children.definition: simply, plainly, ἀλλʼ ἁ. φράσον A. Supp. 464; ἁ. τι φράζουσʼ Id. Ch. 121; ἁ. εἰπεῖν Isoc. 4.154; λαλεῖν Anaxil. 22.23.

children.label: b
children.definition: openly, frankly, Isoc. 3.52, X. HG 4.1.37; in good faith, D. 18.308, etc.: in bad sense, ἁ. ἔχειν to be a simpleton, Isoc. 4.16.

children.label: c
children.definition: in its natural state, uncooked, of food, Jul. Or. 6.192b.

simply, absolutely, ἁ. ἀδύνατον Th. 3.45; τῶν νεῶν κατέδυ οὐδεμία ἁ. no ship was absolutely sunk (though some were disabled), Id. 7.34; ἁ. οὐδὲ ἕν . . συνίημι Philem. 123; ὅσʼ ἐστὶν ἀγαθὰ . . ἁ. simply all the good things there are, Ar. Ach. 873; ἔδωκʼ ἐμαυτὸν ὑμῖν ἁ. D. 18.179; ἁ. absolutely, opp. κατά τι ( relatively), Arist. Top. 115b12; opp. πρός τι, APr. 41a5; opp. πρὸς ἡμᾶς, APo. 72a3; opp. τινί, Top. 116a21; ἁ. βαρύ, κοῦφον, μαλακόν, etc., Cael. 311a17, 27, Mete. 386b32, al.; τὸ ἁ. καλόν, τὸ ἁ. ἀγαθόν, etc., EN 1136b22, 1134b4, al.; opp. ὁτιοῦν ( in some particular), Pol. 1301a29; strengthd. ἁ. οὕτως Pl. Grg. 468c, D. 21.99; τὴν ἁ. δίκην absolute, strict justice, opp. τοὐπιεικές and χάρις, S. Fr. 770; ἡ τελεία καὶ ἁ. κακία Arist. EN 1138a33; τὸ ἁ. the absolute, Dam. Pr. 5: Comp. ἁπλούστερον Is. 4.2; -τερως Str. 6.2.4: Sup. ἁπλούστατα Pl. Lg. 921b.
in a word, E. Rh. 851, X. Cyr. 1.6.33, Mem. 1.3.2, etc.

generally, opp. σαφέστερον, Arist. Pol. 1341b39, al.; ὡς ἁ. εἰπεῖν ib. 1285a31, EN 1115a8, al.; ἁ. δηλῶσαι Hell.Oxy. 11.4; τὸν ἀκριβῶς ἐπιστάμενον λέγειν ἁ. οὐκ ἂν δυνάμενον εἰπεῖν Isoc. 4.11, cf. Demetr. Eloc. 100, 243: in bad sense, loosely, superficially, λίαν ἁ. Arist. Metaph. 987a21, GA 756b17, al.; οὐχ ἁ. φέρειν not lightly, E. IA 899.

data.quote: τὸν ἀκριβῶς ἐπιστάμενον λέγειν ἁ. οὐκ ἂν δυνάμενον εἰπεῖν

children.definition: foolishly, Plu. Adul. 2.72b.
simplification, Plot. 6.9.11.
one must simplify Dam. Pr. 256.
simplifying, c.gen., Dam. Pr. 39.
not navigated, not navigable, Arist. Mir. 839b13; πελάγη Ph. 2.108; ἄπλωτα πάντα ἦν navigation was stopped, App. Mith. 93.

definition: ἀπνεής, ές, corrupt in AP 9.420 as epith. of πῦρ (metaph. of love).

children.definition: without wind or current of air, μεσημβρία Arist. Pr. 911b2, ct. Thphr. CP 1.8.3.
without breath or life, νεκρὰ καὶ ἀ. Simp. in Epict. p.6 D., Orac. ap. Dam. Pr. 453, Tab.Defix.Aud. 22.8 ( Curium, iii A. D.).

without breathing, ζῆν Arist. Pr. 898b24, Resp. 475a23; ἀ. ἔχειν hold oneʼs breath, Pl. Smp. 185d; without drawing breath, Hp. Int. 12; λόγους συνείρειν σαφῶς καὶ ἀ. D. 18.308 ( -τεί), cf. Thphr. Char. 2.9; ἀ. ἕλκειν, ἐκπίνειν, Antiph. 74.14, Alex. 244.3; without breathing, i.e. lifeless, ἀ. κεῖσθαι Plu. QConv. 2.642d; φεύγειν ἀ. breathlessly, Porph. Chr. 49.
holding of the breath, not breathing, Arist. Pr. 881b13, 961b21.
hold the breath, Arist. Pr. 962b31.
breathless, ἄ. καὶ ἄναυδος Od. 5.456, cf. Theoc. 25.271.
lifeless, dead, Nonn. D. 26.115; without life, φαρέτρη ib. 15.269.

children.label: II
children.definition: Thphr. CP 5.12.7 ( Sup.). Adv. -τως, = ἀπνευστί (q.v.), Plu. VOrat. 2.844f.
Anon. ap. Hsch.
suffer from breathlessness, Orib. Syn. 9.44.1.
freedom from wind, Hp. Epid. 3.2.
windlessness, calm, Arist. Pr. 944b12, Plb. 34.11.19 (v.l.); want of wind, Thphr. CP 2.7.5; shelter from wind, Arist. GA 785a29.
absence of respiration, Gal. 7.959.
without wind, with but little air, ἔαρ Hp. Epid. 3.2, cf. Arist. Mete. 361b6, Thphr. CP 2.9.1.
unventilated, οἰκία Plu. Curios. 2.515b; air-tight, κώρυκος Herod. 8.74.

children.label: II
children.definition: breathless, Theopomp.Com. 71.
lifeless, AP 7.229 ( Diosc.), IG 14.1787.
without breathing or respiration, Heraclid.Pont. Fr. 72, 75 Voss, Arist. HA 492a13.

definition: ἀπό, Aeol., Thess., Arc., Cypr. ἀπύ Sapph. 44, cf. 78, Alc. 33, Theoc. 28.16, IG 12(2).6.45 (Mytil.), ἀπυδόμεναι ib. 9(2).594 ( Larissa), 5(2).6 ( Tegea), etc.:—Prep. usually with Gen. but v. infr. B. (Cf. Skt. ápa, Lat. ab, Umbr. ap-ehtre ‘ab extra’, Goth. af, OE. af, cef, of, etc.)

children.definition: from. [ ᾰπŏ: where ἀπō is found in Ep. before ϝ or liquids (as ἀπὸ ἕθεν Il. 6.62, ἀπὸ νευρῆς 11.664, Hes. Sc. 409) ἀπαί was sometimes written in later texts, cf. Eust. 625.11:— ᾱ metri gr. in Ep. compds., such as ἀπονέεσθαι.]

children.label: I
children.definition: Hom. the prevailing sense:

from, away from, ἐσσεύοντο νεῶν ἄπο καὶ κλισιάων Il. 2.208; pleonastic, ἀ. Τροίηθεν ib. 24.492; ἀπʼ οὐρανόθεν 8.365 (later with Advbs., ἀπὸ ἔμπροσθεν LXX Ec. 1.10, etc.); strengthd., ἐκτὸς ἀ. κλισιης Il. 10.151; also ἀπʼ αἰῶνος νέος ὤλεο, implying departure from life, ib. 24.725; opp. ἐξ, of relatively superficial motion, λαμβάνομεν οὔτε ἐκ τῆς γῆς οὐδέν, οὔτʼ ἀπὸ τῶν οἰκιῶν X. Mem. 2.7.2; similarly of the cause or ground, ἐξ ὧν προηγώνισθε καὶ ἀφʼ ὧν εἰκάζω Th. 4.126:— freq. of warriors fighting from chariots, etc., οἱ μὲν ἀφʼ ἵππων, οἱ δʼ ἀ. νηῶν . . μάχοντο Il. 15.386; ἀφʼ ἵππων μάρνασθαι Od. 9.49; so ἡ μάχη ἦν ἀφʼ ἵππων Hdt. 1.79; λαμπὰς ἔσται ἀφʼ ἵππων on horse back, Pl. R. 328a; ἀφʼ ἵππου θηρεύειν X. An. 1.2.7; ἀ. νεῶν πεζομαχεῖν Th. 7.62; ἐν ταῖς ναυσὶν αἰρόμενος τοὺς ἱστοὺς ἀ. τούτων ἐσκοπεῖτο X. HG 6.2.29; ὀμμάτων ἄπο . . κατέσταζον γένυν, of tears, E. Hec. 240: joined with ἐκ, ἐκ Κορίνθου ἀ. τοῦ στρατοπέδου Pl. Tht. 142a.

data.quote: λαμβάνομεν οὔτε ἐκ τῆς γῆς οὐδέν, οὔτʼ ἀπὸ τῶν οἰκιῶν
ἐξ ὧν προηγώνισθε καὶ ἀφʼ ὧν εἰκάζω
οἱ μὲν ἀφʼ ἵππων, οἱ δʼ ἀ. νηῶν . . μάχοντο
ἐν ταῖς ναυσὶν αἰρόμενος τοὺς ἱστοὺς ἀ. τούτων ἐσκοπεῖτο
ἐκ, ἐκ Κορίνθου ἀ. τοῦ στρατοπέδου

children.definition: away from, far from, μένων ἀ. ἧς ἀλόχοιο Il. 2.292 (cf. ἀπʼ ἀνδρὸς εἶναι to live apart from a man or husband, Plu. CG 4); κεκρυμμένος ἀπʼ ἄλλων Od. 23.110; μοῦνος ἀπʼ ἄλλων h.Merc. 193; ἀπʼ ὀφθαλμῶν, ἀπʼ οὔατος, far from sight or hearing, Il. 23.53, 18.272, cf. 22.454; ἀ. θαλάσσης ᾠκίσθησαν Th. 1.7, cf. 46; αὐλίζεσθαι ἀ. τῶν ὅπλων Id. 6.64; ἀπʼ οἴκου εἶναι Id. 1.99; σπεύδειν ἀ. ῥυτῆρος far from, i.e. without using the rein, S. OC 900; in Hom. freq. strengthd., τῆλε ἀ. . ., νόσφιν ἀ. . ., Il. 23.880, 5.322; in measurement of distances, ὅσον ιεʹ στάδια ἀ. Φυλῆς X. HG 2.4.4, etc.; but later the numeral follows ἀ., πηγὰς ἔχων ἀ. μʹ σταδίων τῆς θαλάσσης D.S. 4.56; ἀ. σταδίων κ τῆς πόλεως Plu. Phil. 4; κατεστρατοπέδευσεν ἀ. ν σταδίων fifty stades away, Id. Oth. 11, cf. D.Chr. 17.17.

data.quote: ἀ., πηγὰς ἔχων ἀ. μʹ σταδίων τῆς θαλάσσης

children.definition: ἀ. θυμοῦ away from, i.e. alien from, my heart, Il. 1.562; ἀ. δόξης 10.324; οὐ . . ἀ. σκοποῦ οὐδʼ ἀ. δόξης Od. 11.344; ἀ. τοῦ ἀνθρωπείου τρόπου Th. 1.76; οὐδὲν ἀ. τρόπου not without reason, Pl. R. 470b; οὐκ ἀ. σκοποῦ, καιροῦ, Id. Tht. 179c, 187e; οὐκ ἀ. γνώμης S. Tr. 389; οὐκ ἀ. τοῦ πράγματος D. 24.6; μάλα πολλὸν ἀπʼ ἐλπίδος ἔπλετο A.R. 2.863.

data.quote: οὐ . . ἀ. σκοποῦ οὐδʼ ἀ. δόξης

children.definition: ἐκ) , ἀνὰ δʼ ἐβόασεν . . ἀ. πέτρας σταθείς E. Tr. 523; ἀ.τῆς ἐμῆς κεφαλῆς τὴν [ἐκείνου] κεφαλὴν ἀναδήσω, i. e. taking the chaplet off my head, and placing it on his, Pl. Smp. 212e: with Verbs of hanging, where ἐκ is more common, ἁψαμένη βρόχον ἀ. μελάθρου Od. 11.278.

data.quote: ἀνὰ δʼ ἐβόασεν . . ἀ. πέτρας σταθείς

children.definition: οἱ ἀ. τῶν οἰκιῶν φεύγουσιν, i.e. οἱ ἐν ταῖς οἰκίαις φεύγουσιν ἀπʼ αὐτῶν, X. Cyr. 7.5.23; οἱ ἀ. τῶν πύργων . . ἐπαρήξουσι ib. 6.4.18; αἴρειν τὰ ἀ. τῆς γῆς Pl. Cra. 410b; αἱ ἵπποι αἱ ἀ. τοῦ ἅρματος v.l. in Hdt. 4.8; ὁ Ἀθηναῖος ὁ ἀ. τοῦ στρατεύματος X. An. 7.2.19; τὸν ἀ. γραμμᾶς κινεῖ λίθον Theoc. 6.18.

data.quote: ὁ Ἀθηναῖος ὁ ἀ. τοῦ στρατεύματος

children.definition: λαχὼν ἀ. ληΐδος αἶσαν part taken from the booty, a share of it, Od. 5.40; αἴρεσθαι ἀ. τῶν καλπίδων Ar. Lys. 539; ἀ. ἑκατὸν καὶ εἴκοσι παίδων εἷς μοῦνος Hdt. 6.27; ὀλίγοι ἀ. πολλῶν Th. 7.87, cf. A. Pers. 1023.

data.quote: ἀ. ἑκατὸν καὶ εἴκοσι παίδων εἷς μοῦνος

children.definition: upon a base, κῶνον ἀναγράφειν ἀ. κύκλου Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1.19, etc.; τὸ ἀ. τῆς AB τετράγωνον the square on AB, Euc. 1.47, cf. 48; εἴδεα ἀ. . . Archim. Spir. 10, 11.
ἀ. ἀνθρώπου ἕως γυναικός man and woman, LXX 1 Es. 9.40; ἀ. ἀρσενικοῦ ἕως θηλυκοῦ ib. Nu. 5.3.
from being, instead of, ἀθανάταν ἀ. θνατᾶς . . ἐποίησας Βερενίκαν Theoc. 15.106.
free from, without, ἀ. πάσης ἀκαθαρσίας PLips. 16.19 (ii A. D.); ἀ. ζημίας PTeb 420.4 (iii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: from, after, Hom. only in Il. 8.54 ἀ. δείπνου θωρήσσοντο rising up from, i.e. after, cf. Hdt. 1.133; ἀ. δείπνου εἶναι or γενέσθαι, Id. 1.126, 2.78, 5.18, al.; ἀ. τοῦ σιτίου πίνειν Hp. Salubr. 5; ἀ. τῶν σίτων διαπονεῖσθαι X. Lac. 5.8; in narrative, τὸ ἀ. τούτου or τοῦδε, from this point onwards, Hdt. 1.4, 2.99; ἀ. τούτου τοῦ χρόνου Id. 1.82, X. An. 7.5.8; τὸ ἀπʼ ἐκείνου Luc. Tox. 25; ἡμέρῃ δεκάτῃ ἀφʼ ἧς . . Hdt. 3.14, etc.; δευτέρῃ ἡμέρῃ ἀ. τῆς ἐμπρήσιος Id. 8.55, cf. X. An. 1.7.18, etc.; ἀφʼ οὗ χρόνου Id. Cyr. 1.2.13; more often ἀπʼ or ἀφʼ οὗ, Hdt. 2.44, Th. 1.18, etc.; ἀφʼ οὗπερ A. Pers. 177; ἀφʼ ἧς Plu. Pel. 15; εὐθὺς ἀ. παλαιοῦ, ἀ. τοῦ πάνυ ἀρχαίου, of olden time, Th. 1.2, 2.15; ἀπʼ ἀρχᾶς Pi. P. 8.25, etc.; ἀ. γενεᾶς X. Cyr. 1.2.8; ἀφʼ ἑσπέρας from the beginning of evening, i.e. at eventide, Th. 7.29; ἀ. πρώτου ὕπνου ib. 43; ἀ. μέσων νυκτῶν Ar. V. 218; ἀπʼ ἀγροῦ fresh from field-work, Ev.Marc. 15.21, cf. 7.4; ἀ. νουμηνίας X. An. 5.6.23; χρονίζειν ἀ. τοῦ καιροῦ tarry beyond the time, LXX 2 Ki. 20.5; ἀ. τέλους ἐννέα μηνῶν at the end of . ., ib. 24.8; γενόμενος ἀ. τῆς ἀρχῆς Plu. Caes. 5: hence ἀ. ἀγωνοθετῶν an ex- ἀγωνοθέτης, IG 3.398; ἀ. λογιστῶν POxy. 1103.3 (iv A. D.); οἱ ἀ. ὑπατείας, = consulares, Hdn. 7.1.9, etc.; but ἀ. τινος the freedman of . ., IG 5(2).50.59 ( Tegea, ii A. D.), cf.ib. 5(1).1391 ( Andania), 1473.

from which one is born, οὐ γὰρ ἀ. δρυός ἐσσι οὐδʼ ἀ. πέτρης not sprung from oak or rock, Od. 19.163; γίγνονται δʼ ἄρα ταί γʼ ἔκ τε κρηνέων ἀ. τʼ ἀλσέων 10.350, cf. S. OT 415, OC 571, etc.: sts. ἀπό denotes remote, and ἐκ immediate, descent, τοὺς μὲν ἀ. θεῶν, τοὺς δʼ ἐξ αὐτῶν τῶν θεῶν γεγονότας Isoc. 12.81, cf. Hdt. 7.150; πέμπτη ἀπʼ αὐτοῦ γέννα A. Pr. 853; τρίτος ἀ. Διός third in descent from Zeus, Pl. R. 391c; οἱ ἀ. γένους τινός his descendants, Plu. Them. 32; Περσέως ἀφʼ αἵματος E. Alc. 509: of the place one springs from, ἵπποι . . ποταμοῦ ἄπο Σελλήεντος Il. 2.839. cf. 849; Ἡρακλεῖδαι οἱ ἀ. Σπάρτης Hdt. 8.114, cf. Th. 1.89, etc.; τοὺς ἀ. Φρυγίας X. Cyr. 2.1.5, etc.:hence,

data.quote: γίγνονται δʼ ἄρα ταί γʼ ἔκ τε κρηνέων ἀ. τʼ ἀλσέων
τοὺς μὲν ἀ. θεῶν, τοὺς δʼ ἐξ αὐτῶν τῶν θεῶν γεγονότας

children.label: b
children.definition: Χαρίτων ἄπο κάλλος ἔχουσαι Od. 6.18; θεῶν ἄπο μήδεα εἰδώς ib. 12; γάλα ἀ. βοός A. Pers. 611; μῆνις ἀφʼ ἡμῶν Id. Eu. 314; ἡ ἀφʼ ὑμῶν τιμωρία Th. 1.69; ὁ ἀ. τῶν πολεμίων φόβος fear inspired by the enemy, X. Cyr. 3.3.53.

children.label: c
children.definition: οἱ ἀ. τῆς χώρας, τῆς πόλεως, country folk, towns folk, Plb. 2.6.8, 5.70.8; and so of connexion with the founder or leader of a sect, οἱ ἀ. Πυθαγόρου Luc. Herm. 14; οἱ ἀ. Πλάτωνος Plu. Brut. 2; οἱ ἀ. τοῦ περιπάτου, ἀ. τῆς Στοᾶς, etc., Luc. Cont. 6; generally οἱ ἀ. φιλοσοφίας καὶ λόγων philosophers and learned men, ibid.; οἱ ἀ. σκηνῆς καὶ θεάτρου stage players, Plu. Sull. 2; οἱ ἀ. τῆς βουλῆς Id. Caes. 10, etc.; ὁ ἀφʼ ἑστίας παῖς, v. ἑστία; ἀπʼ ἐξωμίδος with only an ἐξωμίς, S.E. P. 1.153.

from or of which a thing is made, εἵματα ἀ. ξύλου πεποιημένα Hdt. 7.65; ἀπʼ ὄμφακος τεύχειν οἶνον A. Ag. 970, cf. S. Tr. 704; ὅσσα ἀ. γλυκερῶ μέλιτος Theoc. 15.117; ἔνδυμα ἀ. τριχῶν καμήλου Ev.Matt. 3.4: hence στέφανος ἀ. ταλάντων ἑξήκοντα of or weighing 60 talents, Decr. ap. D. 18.92, cf. Plb. 24.1.7, IG 2.555.10, al.: hence of value, θύεν αἶγα ἀ. δραχμᾶν εἴκοσι GDI 3707 ( Cos); κρᾶσις ἀ. τε τῆς ἡδονῆς συγκεκραμένη καὶ ἀ. τῆς λύπης Pl. Phd. 59a; so, by an extension of this use, εἰδεχθής τις ἀ. τοῦ προσώπου ugly of countenance, Thphr. Char. 28.4; θῆλυν ἀ. χροιῆς Theoc. 16.49; σεμνὸς ἀ. τοῦ σχήματος Luc. DMort. 20[10].8.

data.quote: κρᾶσις ἀ. τε τῆς ἡδονῆς συγκεκραμένη καὶ ἀ. τῆς λύπης

children.definition: from or by which a thing is done, τοὺς . . πέφνεν ἀπʼ ἀργυρέοιο βιοῖο by arrow shot from silver bow, Il. 24.605; τόξου ἄπο κρατεροῦ ὀλέκοντα φάλαγγας 8.279; ἐμῆς ἀπὸ χειρός 10.371, 11.675; so ἀ. χειρὸς ἐργάζεσθαι μεγάλα Luc. Hist.Conscr. 29; γυμνάζεσθαι ἀ. σκελῶν, χειρῶν, τραχήλου, X. Lac. 5.9; μάχεσθαι ἀ. ἄκοντος Str. 17.3.7; ἡ ἀ. τοῦ ξίφους μάχη D.S. 5.29; βάπτειν τὸν δάκτυλον ἀ. τοῦ αἵματος LXX Le. 4.7.

data.quote: βάπτειν τὸν δάκτυλον ἀ. τοῦ αἵματος

children.definition: from whom an act comes, i.e. by whom it is done, οὐδὲν μέγα ἔργον ἀπʼ αὐτοῦ ἐγένετο Hdt. 1.14; ζήτησιν ἀ. σφέων γενέσθαι Id. 2.54; ἐπράχθη οὐδὲν ἀπʼ αὐτῶν ἔργον ἀξιόλογον Th. 1.17, cf. 6.61; ἀ. τινος ὄνασθαι Pl. R. 528a, etc.; so τἀπʼ ἐμοῦ, τἀπὸ σοῦ, E. Tr. 74, S. OC 1628; τὰ ἀ. τῶν Ἀθηναίων Th. 1.127; in later Greek freq. of the direct agent, Plb. 1.34.8, Str. 5.4.12, D.H. 9.12, Ev.Luc. 9.22, J. AJ 20.8.10, etc.; in codd. this may sts. be due to confusion with ὑπό, but cf. PMag.Par. 1.256, BGU 1185.26 (Aug.), SIG 820.8 ( Ephesus, i A. D.), etc.

data.quote: οὐδὲν μέγα ἔργον ἀπʼ αὐτοῦ ἐγένετο
ἐπράχθη οὐδὲν ἀπʼ αὐτῶν ἔργον ἀξιόλογον

children.definition: from which life, power, etc., are sustained, ζῆν ἀπʼ ὕλης ἀγρίης Hdt. 1.203; ἀ. κτήνεων καὶ ἰχθύων ib. 216; ἀ. πολέμου Id. 5.6; ἀπʼ ἐλαχίστων χρημάτων X. Mem. 1.2.14; ἀ. τῆς ἀγορᾶς Id. An. 6.1.1; τρέφειν τὸ ναυτικὸν ἀ. τῶν νήσων Id. HG 4.8.9, cf. Th. 1.99; ἀ. τῶν κοινῶν πλουτεῖν Ar. Pl. 569, cf. D. 24.124; ἀ. μικρῶν εὔνους . . γεγένησαι Ar. Eq. 788, cf. D. 18.102; ἀφʼ ὥρας ἐργάζεσθαι quaestum corpore facere, Plu. Tim. 14.

data.quote: τρέφειν τὸ ναυτικὸν ἀ. τῶν νήσων

children.definition: from, by, or because of which a thing is done, ἀ. τούτου κριοπρόσωπον τὤγαλμα τοῦ Διὸς ποιεῦσι Hdt. 2.42; ἀ. τινος ἐπαινεῖσθαι, θαυμάζεσθαι, ὠφελεῖσθαι, Th. 2.25, 6.12, X. Cyr. 1.1.2; ἀ. τῶν ξυμφορῶν διαβάλλεσθαι Th. 5.17; τὴν ἐπωνυμίαν ἔχειν ἀ. τινος Id. 1.46; ἀ. λῃστείας τὸν βίον ἔχειν X. An. 7.7.9; ἀπʼ αὐτῶν τῶν ἔργων κρίνειν D. 2.27; ἀ. τοῦ πάθους in consequence of . ., Th. 4.30; βλάπτειν τινὰ ἀ. τινος Id. 7.29; κατασκευάσαντα τὸ πλοῖον ἀφʼ ὧν ὑπελάμβανε σωθήσεσθαι D. 18.194; τρόπαιον ἀ. τινος εἱστήκει on occasion of his defeat, Id. 19.320; τλήμων οὖσʼ ἀπʼ εὐτόλμου φρενός A. Ag. 1302, cf. 1643; ἀ. δικαιοσύνης by reason of it (v. l. for ὑπό), Hdt. 7.164; ἀ. τῶν αὐτῶν λημμάτων on the same scale of profits, D. 3.34, etc.; for ὅσον ἀ. βοῆς ἕνεκα, v. ἕνεκα: hence in half adverbial usages, ἀ. σπουδῆς in earnest, eagerly, Il. 7.359; ἀ. τοῦἴσου, ἀ. τῆς ἴσης, or ἀπʼ ἴσης, equally, Th. 1.99, 15, D. 14.6, etc.; ἀπʼ ὀρθῆς καὶ δικαίας τῆς ψυχῆς Id. 18.298; ἀ. ἀντιπάλου παρασκευῆς Th. 1.91; ἀ. τοῦ προφανοῦς openly, ib. 35; ἀ. τοῦ εὐθέος straightforwardly, Id. 3.43; ἀ. τοῦ αὐτομάτου of free-will, Pl. Prt. 323c; ἀ. γλώσσης by word of mouth, Hdt. 1.123 (but also, from hearsay, A. Ag. 813); ἀ. στόματος Pl. Tht. 142d; ἀπʼ ὄψεως at sight, Lys. 16.19; ἀ. χειρὸς λογίζεσθαι on your fingers, Ar. V. 656; πεύθομαι δʼ ἀπʼ ὀμμάτων νόστον A. Ag. 988; ὀμμάτων ἄπο in the public gaze, E. Med. 216; ἀ. τοῦ κυάμου ἄρχοντας καθίστασθαι X. Mem. 1.2.9; ἡ βουλὴ ἡ ἀ. τοῦ κυάμου Th. 8.66, cf. IG 1.9; τοὺς ἀ. τοῦ κυάμου δισχιλίους ἄνδρας Arist. Ath. 24.3; τριηράρχους αἱρεῖσθαι ἀ. τῆς οὐσίας Decr. ap. D. 18.106; ἀφʼ ἑαυτοῦ from oneself, on oneʼs own account, Th. 8.6, etc.; ἀφʼ ἑαυτοῦ γνώμης Id. 4.68; ἀ. συνθήματος, ἀ. παραγγέλματος, by agreement, by word of command, Hdt. 5.74, Th. 8.99; ἀ. σάλπιγγος by sound of trumpet, X. Eq.Mag. 3.12 (s.v.l.); ἐπίτροπος ἀ. τῶν λόγων, = Lat. procurator a rationibus, Ann.Epigr.. 1913.143a ( Ephesus, ii A. D.).

data.quote: ἀ. τούτου κριοπρόσωπον τὤγαλμα τοῦ Διὸς ποιεῦσι
κατασκευάσαντα τὸ πλοῖον ἀφʼ ὧν ὑπελάμβανε σωθήσεσθαι
ἀπʼ ὀρθῆς καὶ δικαίας τῆς ψυχῆς
ἡ βουλὴ ἡ ἀ. τοῦ κυάμου
τοὺς ἀ. τοῦ κυάμου δισχιλίους ἄνδρας

children.definition: τὰ ἀ. τῆς νήσου οἰκότα ἐστί the things told from or of the island . ., Hdt. 4.195, cf. 54, 7.195; νόμος κείμενος ἀ. τῶν τεχνῶν Ar. Ra. 762.

children.label: B
children.definition: Arc., Cypr., ἀπύ takes dat., ἀπὺ τᾷ [ἁμέρᾳ] IG 5(2).6 ( Tegea); ἀπὺ τᾷ ζᾷ Inscr.Cypr. 135.8 H. ( Idalion).
ἀπό is found c. acc., PLond. 1.124.30 (iv/v A. D.).

children.label: C
children.definition: Hom. frequent with Verbs in tmesi, as Il. 5.214, etc., and sts. in Prose, as Hdt. 8.89.
asunder, as ἀποκόπτω, ἀπολύω, ἀποτέμνω: and hence, away, off, as ἀποβάλλω, ἀποβαίνω; denoting, removal of an accusation, as ἀπολογέομαι, ἀποψηφίζομαι.
finishing off, completing, ἀπεργάζομαι, ἀπανδρόω, ἀπανθρωπίζω, ἀπογλαυκόω.
ceasing from, leaving off, as ἀπαλγέω, ἀποκηδεύω, ἀπολοφύρομαι, ἀποζέω, ἀπανθίζω, ἀφυβρίζω.
back again, as ἀποδίδωμι, ἀπολαμβάνω, ἀπόπλους: also, in full, or what is oneʼs own, as ἀπέχω, ἀπολαμβάνω: freq. it only strengthens the sense of the simple.
by way of abuse, as in ἀποκαλέω.
ἀπαυδάω, ἀπαγορεύω; more freq. with Adjectives, as ἀποχρήματος, ἀπότιμος, ἀπόσιτος, ἀπόφονος.

children.label: E
children.definition: ἄπο, by anastrophe for ἀπό, when it follows its Noun, as ὀμμάτων ἄπο S. El. 1231, etc.; never in Prose.
ἄπο for ἄπεστι, Semon. 1.20, Timocr. 9.
strip off, remove τί τινος Il. 13.262, Il. 11.582 ( picking flowers in Mosch. 2.66 - thx TK); deprive of, νόστον Od. 12.419, Od. 17.322. [Separate ἀπαίν- entry in DGE]
draw off, Euph. 131.
go away, οἴκαδε Ar. Fr. 475.
ladder for disembarking, gangway, Hdt. 9.98, Th. 4.12, Luc. DMort. 20[10].1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Suid.
sacrifices on disembarkation, D.C. 40.18; perh. to be read in S. Fr. 415.

definition: ἀποβαίνω, fut. -βήσομαι, with Ep. aor. 1 -εβήσετο Il. 2.35: aor. 2 ἀπέβην: pf. ἀποβέβηκα—in these tenses intr. ( pres. not in Hom.):—

children.definition: step off from a place, νηὸς ἀ. alight, disembark from a ship, Od. 13.281; ἀπὸ τῶν νεῶν, ἀπὸ τῶν πλοίων, Hdt. 5.86, 4.110; ἐκ τῶν νεῶν X. HG 5.1.12:abs., disembark, Hdt. 2.29, Th. 1.111, etc.; ἀ. ἐς χώρην Hdt. 7.8.βʹ, cf. E. Fr. 705, Th. 4.9, Lys. 2.21; ἐς τὴν γῆν Th. 1.100; ἐξ ἵππων ἀ. ἐπὶ χθόνα dismount from a chariot, Il. 3.265, cf. 11.619; ἵππων 17.480; but in D. 61.23 τὸ ἀποβαίνειν seems to be the art of leaping from horse to horse (cf. ἀποβάτης) τῇ συνωρίδι τοῦ ἀποβάντος IG 9(2).527.10 ( Larissa): generally, ἀβάτων ἀποβάς having stepped off ground on which none should step, S. OC 167.

go away, depart, Il. 1.428, 5.133, etc.; ἀπέβη πρὸς μακρὸν Ὄλυμπον 24.468; πρὸς δώματα, κατὰ δῶμα, Od. 4.657, 715; μετʼ ἀθανάτους Il. 21.298: c. gen., ἀ. πεδίων E. Hec. 140; ἀπὸ τῆς φάτνης X. Eq.Mag. 1.16; of death, ἀπὸ δὲ φθίμενοι βεβᾶσι E. Andr. 1022; of hopes, vanish, come to nought, Id. Ba. 909 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: issue, result from, τὰ ἔμελλε ἀποβήσεσθαι ἀπὸ τῆς μάχης Hdt. 9.66; τἀναντία ἀπέβη resulted, Pl. Phlb. 39a, cf. Lg. 782e; ὅ τι ἀποβήσεται Id. Prt. 318a, etc.; τὸ ἀποβαῖνον, contr. τὠποβαῖνον, the issue, event, Hdt. 2.82, etc.; τὰ ἀποβαίνοντα, τὸ ἀποβάν, the results, Th. 1.83, 2.87; τὰ ἀποβησόμενα the probable results, Id. 3.38, cf. S.E. M. 5.103.

data.quote: τὰ ἔμελλε ἀποβήσεσθαι ἀπὸ τῆς μάχης

children.definition: Adv. or other qualifying phrase, σκοπέειν . . τὴν τελευτὴν κῇ ἀποβήσεται how it will turn out, issue, Hdt. 1.32; ἀ. τῇ περ εἶπε ib. 86; ἀ. κατὰ τὸ ἐόν ib. 97; ἀ. παρὰ δόξαν, ἀ. τοιοῦτον, Id. 8.4, 7.23; τοιόνδʼ ἀπέβη τόδε πρᾶγμα E. Med. 1419, cf. X. Cyr. 1.5.13; πολέμου τοιοῦτον ἀπέβη τὸ τέλος Plb. 26.6.15; οὐδὲν αὐτῷ . . ὡς προσεδέχετο ἀπέβαινεν Th. 4.104, cf. 3.26; παρὰ γνώμην ἀ. 5.14; opp. κατὰ γνώμαν ἀ. Theoc. 15.38; πῶς ἡ φήμη δοκεῖ ὑμῖν ἀποβῆναι; And. 1.131.

data.quote: πῶς ἡ φήμη δοκεῖ ὑμῖν ἀποβῆναι;

children.definition: turn out well, succeed, ἡ ὑπόσχεσις ἀπέβη Th. 4.39, cf. 5.14; of dreams, turn out true, Arist. Div. Somn. 463b10.

Adj., turn out, prove to be so and so, ἀ. οὐ κοινοί prove partial, Th. 3.53; ἀ. χείρους Pl. Lg. 952b; φρενιτικοὶ ἀ. Hp. Coac. 405; τύραννος ἐκ βασιλέως ἀ. Plb. 7.13.7; also of a wound, ἰάσιμον ἀ. Pl. Lg. 878c.

children.label: b
children.definition: εἰς . ., ἀ. εἰς τὰ πολιτικὰ οἱ τοιοῦτοι prove fit for public affairs, Id. Smp. 192a; ἐς ἀλαθινὸν ἄνδρʼ ἀ. Theoc. 13.15.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἀπέβη ἐς μουναρχίην things ended in a monarchy, Hdt. 3.82; εἰς ἓν τέλεον καὶ νεανικόν Pl. R. 425c; ἀποβήσεται εἰς μαρτυρίαν Ev.Luc. 21.13.
μέγεθος μὲν ἦν πρὸς τὸν Ἠριδανὸν ἀποβεβηκῦα reaching, extending to . ., Pl. Criti. 112a.
τῷ ἀποβεβηκότι ποδί with the hind foot, opp. τῷ προβεβηκότι, Arist. IA 706a9.

children.label: B
children.definition: aor. 1 ἀπέβησα, cause to dismount, disembark, land (in which sense ἀποβιβάζω serves as pres.), ἀ. στρατιήν Hdt. 5.63, 6.107; ἐς τὴν Ψυττάλειαν Id. 8.95.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., τὸ ἀποβαινόμενον σκέλος a leg put out so as not to bear the weight of the body, Hp. Art. 52:— Act., Id. Mochl. 20.

throw off, ἀπὸ δὲ χλαῖναν βάλε Il. 2.183, cf. 21.51; ἀπὸ φροντίδος ἄχθος . . βαλεῖν A. Ag. 166: c. gen., throw off from, ἀ. ὀμμάτων ὕπνον E. Ba. 692:— Med., throw off from oneself, cast off, δύναμιν βασιλέως And. 3.29.

throw away, h.Merc. 388, Hdt. 3.40, etc.; ἀ. τὴν ἀσπίδα Ar. V. 22, And. 1.74, Lys. 10.9, etc.; τὸν ἄνδρα τὸν πάρος ἀ. reject him, E. Tr. 663, cf. Pl. Tht. 151c, etc.; ἀ. τὰ κέρατα, τὰς ὁπλάς, cast, shed, Arist. HA 500a10, 604a15, al.:— Med., Pl. Lg. 802b; οὐδεὶς ἀ. ἑκών jettisons cargo, Arist. EN 1110a9; ἀ. τὸν φιλέοντα Theoc. 11.19; expose a child, Leg.Gort. 4.9; despise, reject, Hp. Ep. 10:— Pass., ἀποβληθεὶς τῆς τυραννίδος Plu. Comp.Dion.Brut. 3.

children.label: b
children.definition: throw away, sell too cheap, X. Oec. 20.28.

lose, τὴν τυραννίδα Hdt. 1.60; τὰ πατρώια, τὸν στρατόν, τὴν κεφαλήν, Id. 3.53, 8.65, al.; βιοτάν S. Fr. 593; τὴν οὐσίαν Ar. Ec. 811, Pl. Cri. 44e, etc.; ἱκανὸν μέρος τῶν ὄντων Antipho 2.1.6, etc.; opp. κτᾶσθαι, Isoc. 6.57, Arist. Pol. 1291b41; ἀ.δόξαν, τέχνην, Id. de An. 428b5, Metaph. 1047a1, al.; ἀ. τι ὑπό τινος X. Smp. 4.32; ἀ. πολλοὺς τῶν στρατιωτῶν Th. 4.7; τὸν εὐεργέταν E. HF 878:—in Med., ἀγαθὸν πολίτην SIG 730.20 ( Olbia).

children.label: b
children.definition: drop a letter, etc., A.D. Pron. 36.21, al.
degrade, Pl. Lg. 630d.
water drawn from a sacred spring, IG 4.1607 ( Cleonae).

children.label: II
children.definition: tincture, infusion, Sch. Nic. Al. 51.

dip, plunge, ἑωυτόν Hdt. 2.47; ἐς τὴν κύλικα ἀκινάκεα Id. 4.70; εἰς ποταμὸν τὰ γιγνόμενα Arist. Pol. 1336a16; λίθον ἐν οἴνῳ Id. HA 607a25; φαρμάκῳ τοὺς ὀϊστούς Id. Mir. 845a1: metaph., ἀ. τὴν λέξιν εἰς νοῦν Plu. Phoc. 5:— Pass., ὅστις ἐν ἅλμη . . ἀπεβάφθη Ar. Fr. 416; περιστερὰς ἀποβεβαμμένας εἰς μύρον Alex. 62.3.
ἀ. ὕδωρ draw water, LXX 2 Ma. 1.21.
ex-king, AB 1089.

stepping off, disembarking, ἀπὸ τῶν νεῶν ἐς τὴν Λοκρίδα ἀποβάσεις ποιησάμενοι Th. 3.103, cf. 115; ἡ ναντικὴ ἐπʼ ἄλλους ἀ. landing from ships in the face of an enemy, Id. 4.10: abs., ποιεῖσθαι ἀ. disembark, land, Id. 2.26; ἀ. ἐστι a landing is possible, Id. 4.13, cf. 6.75; οὐκ ἔχει ἀπόβασιν does not admit of landing, or has no landing-place, Id. 4.8; ἐν ἀποβάσει τῆς γῆς, = ἀποβάντες ἐς τὴν γῆν, Id. 1.108.

data.quote: ἀπὸ τῶν νεῶν ἐς τὴν Λοκρίδα ἀποβάσεις ποιησάμενοι

children.definition: Plb. 8.4.4 ἐξ ἀποβάσεως ἰσοϋψὴς τῷ τείχει, of a ladder, equal in height to the wall, when planted at the proper distance from its foot, cf. Id. 9.19.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: way of escape, Plu. Sol. 14.

children.label: III
children.definition: result, issue, τῶν εἰρημένων Aret. SA 2.4, Luc. Hes. 6 (pl.), Artem. 4.83; of prophecies, Phld. D. 1.25; success in a race (prob.), Tab.Defix.Aud. 234.59 ( Carthage, i A.D.), al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: IG 7.4254 ( Oropus, iv B.C.).

children.label: V
children.definition: sequence, Theol.Ar. 60.
as protector of persons landing, Arr. An. 1.11.7; of Artemis, IGRom. 4.1539 ( Erythrae).

children.label: II
children.definition: τὰ ἀ. (sc. ἱερά) offerings made on landing, St.Byz. s.v. Βουθρωτός, Poll. 2.200.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀ. τόπος place of landing, of Mt. Ararat, J. AJ 1.3.5.
one that dismounts; but in usage, one who rode several horses leaping from one to the other, ἀποβάτην ἀγωνίσασθαι Plu. Phoc. 20, cf. IG 2.966, al., D.H. 7.73, AB 198,426, EM 124.31, Suid.
of or for an ἀποβάτης, ἀγών IG 9(2).527,531 ( Larissa). Adv. -κῶς EM 124.31.
reject with abhorrence, Eustr. in EN 19.4.
take off the spit, f.l. in Sotad.Com. 1.10.
degrade from oneʼs rank or station, Plu. Nob. 21.
cough up, Hp. Aph. 5.11, Prog. 23: fut. -βήξομαι Id. Mul. 1.41.

force away, force back, τὸ ὑγρόν Arist. IA 714a19; τὸ κωλῦον Id. Pr. 903b5, cf. GA 737b29, Mete. 368b10, PPetr. 3p.39 (iii B.C.):— Pass., to be forced away or back, X. Cyr. 4.2.24, Arist. Mete. 364a29; ἀ. εἰς ἐλάττω τόπον to be forced into . ., ib. 366b11.
treat with violence, τινά Plb. 16.24.5: abs., 33.9.5, cf. SIG 629.20 ( Delph., ii B. C.), Wilcken Chr. 11 A 30 (ii B. C.): metaph., κατὰ τὰς λέξεων ὁμιλίας Phld. Oec. p.59J.

children.label: II
children.definition: use force, X. Cyr. 3.1.19, Arist. Mete. 364b8, al.: force its way, ib. 351a6:— Act. ἀπο-βιάζω, Sch. Theoc. 6.18.

make to get off, esp. from a ship, disembark, put on shore, τινά Th. 6.97, etc.; τινὰ εἰς τόπον Hdt. 8.76, Pl. Grg. 511e; ἐς τὴν πολεμίαν ἀποβιβάζων τὸν πόδα Ar. V. 1163; ἀ. τινὰ ὅποι αὐτὸς κελεύοι X. HG 7.4.3:— Med., ἀποβιβάσασθαί τινας ἀπὸ τῶν νεῶν cause them to be put on shore, Hdt. 9.32.

data.quote: ἐς τὴν πολεμίαν ἀποβιβάζων τὸν πόδα

children.definition: disembarkation, Iamb. VP 3.17.
eat off, in aor. Pass. χεῖρας ἀποβρωθέντα AP 7.294 (Tull. Laur.).
cease to live, λάθε ἀποβιώσας Philostr. VA 8.28; ἀπεβίω Hld. 4.7, cf. Ant.Diog. 10.
ceasing to live, death, Plu. E apud Delph. 2.389a, CIG 4253 ( Lycia), al.
Herm. in Phdr. p.202A.
ruin utterly, Pi. N. 7.60, Pl. Lg. 795d:— Pass., ἀποβλαφθῆναι φίλον to be robbed of a friend, S. Aj. 941.
shoot forth from, spring from, ἀπέβλαστον ματρὸς ὠδῖνος S. OC 533, cf. Plu. Frig. 2.954c, Hierocl. in CA 17p.459M., Iamb. Myst. 3.20.
shoot, Thphr. CP 1.20.1: metaph., τὸ ἑαυτοῦ ἀ. πᾶς φιλεῖ Pl. Smp. 208b.
shooting forth, growth, νεύρων Hp. Art. 45, cf. Gal. UP 8.6; of roots, Dsc. 2.183.
steadfast gaze, Phryn.Com. 75.
one must consider, Gal. 11.407.
gazed on by all, admired, E. Hec. 355, Procop. Arc. 9, al.

definition: ἀποβλέπω, fut. -βλέψομαι Luc. Somn. 12, etc., but -βλέψω Hero Spir. 2.34: pf. -βέβλεφα Antip.Stoic. 3.254 codd. Stob.:— Med., pres., Luc. VH 2.47 (v.l.): aor., Sch. Od. 12.247:— Pass., Ar. Ec. 726:—

children.definition: look away from all other objects at one, gaze steadfastly, ἐς ἐμέ Hdt. 7.135; εἴς σε E. Andr. 246, cf. Pl. Chrm. 162b, al.; ἐς ἀκτάς E. Hipp. 1206; ἐς μίαν τύχην Id. Hel. 267; πρὸς τὸ Ἥραιον Hdt. 9.61, cf. Pl. R. 431b; πρός τινα Id. Phd. 115c, Phdr. 234d, al.

pay attention to, regard, ἐς τὸ κακόν Ar. Ra. 1171; πρὸς τὰ κοινά E. Supp. 422; εἰς τὰ πράγματα ἀ. φαύλως ἔχοντα D. 2.29; εἰς τὸ κέρδος μόνον Demetr.Com.Vet. 4; εἰς τὴν μισθαποδοσίαν Ep.Hebr. 11.26; ἐπί τι Pl. Phlb. 61d; κατά τι Luc. DMort. 5[18].1; πρός τι Pl. R. 477c, al.; εἰς τὰ πράγματα καὶ πρὸς τοὺς λόγους ἀ. D. 3.1: c. acc., Thphr. Vert. 8, Plu. Luc. 26, etc.

data.quote: εἰς τὰ πράγματα ἀ. φαύλως ἔχοντα
εἰς τὰ πράγματα καὶ πρὸς τοὺς λόγους ἀ.

children.definition: look, face in a particular direction, πρὸς ὁδόν D.C. 76.11 (of a statue); Ῥήνου προχοάς AP 9.283 ( Crin.); ἐπὶ τὴν ἀνατολήν J. AJ 11.5.5.

look upon with love, wonder or admiration, look at as a model, c. acc., οὐ χρὴ . . μέγαν ὄλβον ἀ. S. Fr. 593; ἀ. τινά Luc. Vit.Auct. 10, cf. D. 19.265; προϊόντα ἴσα θεῷ ἀπέβλεπον Philostr. VA 5.24; more freq. with a Prep., εἰς ἔμʼ Ἑλλὰς . . ἀ. E. IA 1378; ἡ σὴ πατρὶς εἰς σὲ ἀ. X. HG 6.1.8, cf. Th. 3.58; εἰς τὴν εὐσέβειαν τῆς θεοῦ SIG 867.11 ( Ephesus); so ἀ. πρός τινα E. IT 928, X. Mem. 4.2.30, Thphr. Char. 2.2; of a vain person, ἀ. εἰς τὴν ἑαντῆς σκιάν X. Mem. 2.1.22; of entire dependence, πάντα ἀ. εἰς τὸν ἐραστήν Pl. Phdr. 239b; εἰς ἀλλοτρίαν τράπεζαν X. An. 7.2.33; look longingly, ἐς τὸν ἀγρόν Ar. Ach. 32:— Pass., to be looked up to, Id. Ec. 726, Aeschin.Socr. Fr. 56D.; ὡς εὐδαίμων ἀ. Luc. Nigr. 13, cf. Somn. 11.

data.quote: ἡ σὴ πατρὶς εἰς σὲ ἀ.

children.definition: ἐς τοιόνδʼ ἀποβλέψας μόνον τροαῖον αὐτοῦ στήσομαι with a single look, E. Andr. 762.

data.quote: ἐς τοιόνδʼ ἀποβλέψας μόνον τροαῖον αὐτοῦ στήσομαι

children.label: II
children.definition: look away, D.Chr. 21.13: c.gen., Philostr. Im. 1.1; ἀ. ἀπʼ ἀμφοτέρων face both ways, dub. in X. HG 2.3.31; ἀπὸ τοῦ συμφέροντος Antip. l.c.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., look at each other, ταυρωπὸν ἀποβλεψάμενοι Ph. 1.602.

definition: ἀπόβλεψις, εως, ἡ, of a place, ἀ. ἔχειν πρὸς βορρᾶν

children.definition: look towards . ., Gp. 2.3.7.
anything cast away, LXX Wi. 13.13, Sch. Ar. Eq. 412.
fit to be cast away, CPHerm. 119rvi5 (iii A.D.).
outpouring; μέθης ἀ., of exclamations uttered in liquor, Eust. 1767.59.
to be thrown away, rejected, Pl. R. 387b, Luc. Herm. 18.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀποβλητέον one must reject, A.D. Conj. 226.10.
apt to throw off, καρπῶν Thphr. CP 2.9.3.

definition: ἀπόβλητος, ον, ( η, ον D.L. 7.127, Iamb. Myst. 1.19),

children.definition: to be thrown away or aside, as worthless, οὔ τοι ἀπόβλητʼ ἐστὶ θεῶν ἐρικυδέα δῶρα Il. 3.65; οὔ τοι ἀπόβλητον ἔπος ἔσσεται 2.361; γίγαρτον Simon. 88, etc., cf. Hp. Ep. 10 and late Prose, as Ph. 2.294, Luc. Tox. 37, Plu. Praec. 2.821a, Plot. 6.7.31, Procop. Arc. 11.

data.quote: οὔ τοι ἀπόβλητʼ ἐστὶ θεῶν ἐρικυδέα δῶρα

children.definition: capable of being thrown off, Iamb. l.c.; capable of being lost, D.L. l.c.
cut out the comb from the hive: hence, steal away, carry off, ὁ δʼ ἀπέβλῐσε θοἰμάτιόν μου Ar. Av. 498: aor. Med. ἀπεβλίσατο cj. Reisk. in AP 7.34 ( Antip. Sid.).
spirt out, ἀ. οἴνου spirt out some wine, Il. 9.491, cf. Archil. 32; ὑδαρὲς ἀ. Aret. SD 2.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: flow forth, πηγαὶ ἀ. τῶν ὀρῶν Philostr. Im. 1.9, cf. Procop. Aed. 2.2, al.

definition: ἀποβλυστάνω, = foreg., πηγαὶ ἀ. ὕδωρ Procop. Aed. 1.11.

children.definition: go away, A.R. 3.1143.
one who has lost, ὅπλων Pl. Lg. 944b.
throwing away, e.g. ὅπλων Pl. Lg. 943e sq.; jettison, Ph. 2.413; in Gramm., dropping of a letter, etc., A.D. Pron. 55.7, al.; τόνου Synt. 130.1.
loss, opp. κτῆσις, χρημάτων Pl. La. 195e, Arist. EN 1115a21, etc.; ἐπιστήμης Pl. Phd. 75d, cf. Euphro 1.27: pl., τὰς τῶν κακῶν ἀ. Arist. Rh. 1362a36, cf. Isoc. 3.32.
apt to throw away, c.gen., τῶν ὅπλων Ar. Pax 678.
Pass., usually thrown away, worthless, Gloss.
become a cow, Eust. 278.32.
most northerly, POxy. 506.26 (ii A. D.).
feed upon, καρπόν Ar. Av. 749, 1066.
lead astray, as cattle, βοῦς ἐς τὴν ἰδίαν ἀγέλην Longus 1.27.
lead away shepherds from the sheep, τῶν θρεμμάτων Chor. p.92B [1.2.53].

let stray, lose (as a bad shepherd does his sheep), χαρίεν γὰρ εἰ . . τῇ θυγατρὶ τὸν παῖδα ἀποβουκολήσαιμι . . if I were to lose my daughter her son, X. Cyr. 1.4.13:— Pass., stray, lose oneʼs way, Luc. Nav. 4.
beguile, soothe, Id. Am. 16; lead astray, seduce, Id. Bis Acc. 13.
Chor. in Rh.Mus. 49.522.
that which is thrown off, Alex.Trall. Febr. 6; scum, Hsch.; chaff, Id., Suid.
throwing off of scum, S.E. M. 9.103.

definition: ἀποβράσσω, Att. ἀποβράττω, Poll. 6.91: mostly in aor. -έβρᾰσα:—

children.definition: throw out froth, like boiling water, and metaph., shake, sift out the bran from the meal, Call. Fr. 232:— Pass., spirt out, Hp. Nat.Puer. 31; to be cast ashore, Thphr. Fr. 30.3; νεκροὶ ἀπεβράσθησαν εἰς τοὺς αἰγιαλούς Ph. 2.174.
εἰς τὰ τῆς ἐσχατιᾶς ib. 354.

children.label: II
children.definition: cease to boil, Alciphr. 1.23.
infusion, Agatharch. 61, Str. 16.4.17, Dsc. 4.81, Aret. CA 1.1, Plu. QConv. 2.614b.
moistening, Aq., Sm. Nu. 6.3, Gal. 6.652.

steep well, soak, Thphr. CP 2.5.5, IG 4.955.9 (Epid.): metaph., τὴν γλῶσσαν εἰς νοῦν ἀ. Zeno Stoic. 1.67, cf. Suid. s.v. Ἀριστοτέλης:— Pass., aor. part. -βρεχθείς Thphr. HP 5.9.5; -βραχείς Dsc. 1.110: metaph., ὡς τὰ ἄχη τῆς ψυχῆς ἀποβρέχοιτο Philostr. VA 7.22.

data.quote: ὡς τὰ ἄχη τῆς ψυχῆς ἀποβρέχοιτο

children.definition: go off to sleep, go sound asleep, Od. 9.151: aor. imper. ἀπόβριξον Theoc. Ep. 19; ὕπνον ἀ. Call. Epigr. 18; βαιὸν ἀποβρίξαντες Q.S. 5.661.
swallow, gulp down part of a thing (cf. ἀναβρόξειε), prob. l. AP 7.506 ( Leon.); cf. ἀποβρύκω.
gulp down, Ar. Fr. 236.
ligature, Sor. 1.80, Gal. 14.784.

children.label: II
children.definition: bind tightly, λαιμόν AP 9.410 (Tull. Sab.).

children.label: III
children.definition: strangle, ἑαυτόν Polyaen. 8.63.
making a ligature, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.3.
one must make a ligature, Arching. ap. Orib. 47.13.5.
bite off, eat greedily of, τῶν κρεῶν (partit. gen.) Eub. 42: abs., bite in pieces, Archipp. 35; ἀπέβρυξεν is v.l. (Planud.) for -έβροξεν in AP 7.506 ( Leon.).
something devoured, Ps.-Callisth. 3.15.
stop up, AB 426.
far from an altar, godless, Κύκλωψ E. Cyc. 365.

children.label: II
children.definition: Eust. 1720.28, literally, not offered on an altar, but on the ground.
not suitable for an offering, IG 5(2).403 (Lusi, dub.).
make into land, Heraclit. All. 22 ( Pass.): Medic., form a stone, Gal. 19.648,672; cf. ἀπογεόομαι.
wean from the motherʼs milk, Diph. 74, LXX Ge. 21.8, Sor. 1.116, POxy. 37i22 (i A. D.), PLips. 31.20 (ii A.D.).
weaning, Ar.Byz. Epit. 42.14.
one must wean, Sor. 1.78.
to become milky, Antyll. ap. Orib. 4.11.6.
weaned, Aët. 4.29.
calm down, ἑαυτόν prob. in Plu. QConv. 2.655b.
become calm, Ps.-Democr. Symp.Ant. p.4 G.
calm down, of physical disturbances, Sor. 1.46.
from land, coming off land, ἄνεμοι, πνεῦμα, Arist. Mu. 394b14, Mete. 363a1, cf. Thphr. CP 2.3.1; ἡ ἀ. (sc. αὔρα) land breeze, Arist. Pr. 940b24; αἱ ἀπόγεαι ib. 945a4; τὰ ἀ. ib. 940b18.
ἀπόγαιον or ἀπόγειον, τό, mooring cable, Plb. 33.9.6, Luc. VH 1.42, Polem. Call. 26, Lib. Or. 59.139, 61.21, etc.; in full, ἀπόγεια ( -γυια cod.) σχοινία Hsch. s.v. γύαια; cf. ἀπόγυον.

children.label: II
children.definition: far from the earth, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.933b, cf. Olymp. in Mete. 10.14, al.: Comp., Cleom. 2.6, Ptol. Alm. 9.1: Sup., Theo Sm. p.157 H.; τὸ ἀ. (sc. σημεῖον), in Astronomy, a planetʼs greatest distance from the earth, apogee, Ptol. Alm. 3.3.
from the shore, Luc. Lex. 15.

crown with a cornice, γείσοις Κορινθίοις IG 2(2).463.71, cf. BCH 35.12 ( Delos): metaph., make to jut out like a cornice, ὀφρύσι ἀ. τὰ ὑπὲρ τῶν ὀμμάτων X. Mem. 1.4.6:— Pass., jut out like a cornice, Arist. GA 781b13.

data.quote: ὀφρύσι ἀ. τὰ ὑπὲρ τῶν ὀμμάτων

children.definition: projecting cornice: metaph. of eyebrows, Arist. PA 58b16.
discharge her cargo, D.H. 3.44; to be emptied of contents, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 24.
decease, τὰς τῶν ψυχῶν γενέσεις καὶ ἀ. Porph. Antr. 31, cf. 24, Plot. 3.4.6.

data.quote: τὰς τῶν ψυχῶν γενέσεις καὶ ἀ.

children.definition: produce, Hp. Morb. 1.25 ( Pass.); τὸ ὅμοιον Thphr. CP 1.16.12; γάλα Sor. 1.27; συμπτώματα Gal. 7.200; of atoms generating bodies, Epicur. Nat. 22 G., cf. Diog.Oen. 20, Aen.Gaz. Thphr. p.42B.; ἀ. δυσμένειαν Demad. 15:— Pass., Epicur. Ep. 2p.40U.; τὰ ὑπὸ μεγαλοφροσύνης -ώμενα Longin. 15.12, cf. Ph. 1.144, Plot. 6.1.6, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: destroy, ἐγώ εἰμι ὁ γεννῶν καὶ ὁ ἀπογεννῶν PMag.Lond. 46.155.

data.quote: ἐγώ εἰμι ὁ γεννῶν καὶ ὁ ἀπογεννῶν

children.definition: offspring, Ti.Locr. 97e, Ael. NA 15.8.
generation, Sch. Epicur. Ep. 3p.47U., Jul. Or. 4.153c, Procl. Inst. 152.
to be changed into earth, Ph. 2.508 (cj.).
give one a taste of, AP 4.3.39 ( Agath.); opp. ἀποπληρόω, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., take a taste of, σιτίων Hp. Epid. 7.2, cf. Pl. R. 354b, Tht. 157d, X. Cyr. 1.3.4, Plb. 3.57.8; ἑκάστου μικρὸν ἀ. Eub. 42, cf. Antiph. 326: metaph., ἐλπίδος Ph. 2.338.
tasting, τῶν παθῶν Olymp. in Alc. p.6C., cf. PMag.Leid.W. 9.34.
bank off, fence with dykes, τὴν Μέμφιν Hdt. 2.99.

grow old, Thgn. 821, Hp. Aph. 2.20; part. ἀπογηράς dub. l. Alex. 278; inf. ἀπογηρᾶν, of senile dementia, Gal. 16.696; ἀπεγήρασα Thphr. HP 7.13.6; of vines, ὅσσαι δέ κα . . ἀπογηράσκωντι fail from old age, Tab.Heracl. 1.170.

definition: ἀπογίγνομαι, Ion. and later Att. ἀπογίνομαι, fut. -γενήσομαι:—

children.definition: to be away from, have no part in, τῆς μάχης Hdt. 9.69; τῶν ἁμαρτημάτων Th. 1.39; to be freed from, κακῶν ἀπογεγονότες J. AJ 19.2.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be taken away, opp. προσγίγνομαι, Zeno Eleat. 2, Pl. Ti. 82b, Lg. 850a; ἀπεγίγνετο οὐδέν . . προσεγίγνετο δέ Th. 2.98: generally, to be away, absent, Antipho 2.3.5, Pl. Phd. 69b, D. 8.35: ἀπό τινος Aeschin. 2.126; of diseases, opp. προσπίπτω, Hp. Morb.Sacr. 1 (dub. l.).

ἀ. ἐκ τῶν οἰκίων depart from the house, die out of it, Hdt. 2.85; ἀπογενέσθαι alone, to be dead, ib. 136, cf. IG 9(1).334.37 ( Locr.), Ocell. 1.14; οἱ ἀπογενόμενοι the dead, Th. 2.34; ὁ ὕστατον αἰεὶ ἀ. he who died last, Hdt. 6.58. cf. 5.4; οἱ ἀπογιγνόμενοι the dying, Th. 2.51, Hdt. 3.111.
fall away, be lost, Th. 5.74; opp. ἐκβλαστάνω, Paus. 5.12.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: arrive at, ἀ. δωδεκαταῖος Hp. Epid. 4.11.

children.label: IV
children.definition: turn out, become, τράχηλος σκληρὸς ἀ. ib. 12 (dub. l.); νωθροὶ ἀ. Id. Prorrh. 1.117 (dub.l.).

children.label: V
children.definition: ἀ. τὸ ἕκτον μέρος εἰς τρίχας καὶ αἷμα goes into, is consumed in forming . ., Arist. HA 595b1.

data.quote: ἀ. τὸ ἕκτον μέρος εἰς τρίχας καὶ αἷμα

definition: ἀπογιγνώσκω, Ion. and later Att. ἀπογῑνώσκω, fut. -γνώσομαι:—

children.definition: depart from a judgement, give up a design or intention of doing, τοῦ μάχεσθαι X. An. 1.7.19, cf. Plb. 1.29.5, etc.; ἀ. τὸ κατὰ γῆν πορεύεσθαι X. HG 7.5.7; ἀ. διώκειν Plu. Ant. 34, cf. Thes. 6; ἀ. μὴ βοηθεῖν resolve not to help, D. 15.9, cf. IG 2(2).457.30: c.gen., give up a notion, Simp. in Ph. 610.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: despair of, τῆς ἐλευθερίας Lys. 2.46; οὐδενὸς χρὴ πράγματος ὅλως ἀπογνῶναι Men. 131; ὡς ἀνιάτων D.Chr. 32.97; ὑπὲρ σφῶν Jul. Or. 2.61c: abs., despair, D. 4.42 (where some codd. supply ἑαυτῶν), Babr. 43.18: c. fut. inf., αἱρήσειν ἀ. Arr. An. 3.20.3; ἀκούσεσθαι Luc. Icar. 10: c. aor. inf., τὴν πόλιν ἀπέγνω ἑλεῖν Arr. An. 1.5.8, cf. D.Chr. 32.9.

give up as hopeless or desperate, τὴν σωτηρίαν Arist. EN 1115b2; τὰς πρεσβείας Plb. 5.1.5, al.; τὰς ἐλπίδας Id. 2.35.1; ἀ. τι ἀπὸ τῶν παρόντων App. Hisp. 37; ἀρετῆς ἀκρίβειαν Porph. Antr. 36; ἀ. αὑτόν Plb. 21.26.14:— Pass., to be given up, τὰ παρʼ ὑμῶν D. 19.54; ἐλπίς D.H. 5.15; ἐλευθερία Luc. Tyr. 6; ἀπεγνωσμέναι ἐλπίδες forlorn hopes, Plb. 30.8.3; ἐπιβουλὴ -μένη Hdn. 4.4.3; ἀπεγνωσμένοι ἄνθρωποι desperate men, Id. 1.16.4 (but ἄνθρωποι ἀπεγνωκότες Plu.
