children.definition: ἀ. τινὰ τοῦ λόγου cut him off from his speech, interrupt him in it, Ar. Nu. 1408.

definition: ἀποσχίς, ίδος, ἡ, mostly in pl., ἀποσχίδες

children.definition: branches of veins, Hp. Oss. 6, Aret. CA 2.2; ὀστῶν Gal. 18(2).781; of a mountain, spurs, Str. 11.12.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: branch of the bile-duct, Gal. 2.578.
division, branching, of a vein, Arist. HA 514a13, Aret. CA 2.2.
that which is severed, M.Ant. 4.29.
separate by a cord: hence generally, bar, exclude, ἀπεσχοινισμένος πᾶσι τοῖς ἐν τῇ πόλει δικαίοις D. 25.28: abs., Plu. Virt.mor. 2.443c; ἀρετῆς Ph. 1.205; ἀ. τινά τινος ib. 219, cf. Lib. Decl. 23.45.

data.quote: ἀπεσχοινισμένος πᾶσι τοῖς ἐν τῇ πόλει δικαίοις

children.definition: rest, recreate oneself, ἔν τινι Arist. EN 1176b17.
have leisure for, devote oneself to, τῷ οἴνῳ Ael. VH 12.1.
spend oneʼs leisure with one, go to him for teaching, Ps.- Hdt. Vit.Hom. 5,34.
shunning the schools, f.l. in Timo 50.
save or preserve from, νόσου S. Ph. 1379; ἐκ τῶν ναυαγίων -σωθέντες Luc. Herm. 86; ἀ. οἴκαδε bring safe home, X. HG 7.2.19, cf. An. 2.3.18.
keep safe, Pl. Phlb. 26c, Lg. 692c, IG 2.268; ἀ. πατρὸς γνώμας keep them in mind, remember, E. Fr. 362.2.
preserve, τὴν τάξιν, of the pulse, Gal. 14.635.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., ἀποσωθῆναι ἐς . . to get safe to a place, Hdt. 5.87, 7.229, X. HG 1.3.22; ἐπὶ θάλατταν ib. 3.1.2: abs., get off safe, Hdt. 2.107, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., ἀ. γενομένη come safely into being, Pl. Ep. 336b.
conversion from corporeal substance, ὑδάτων Zos.Alch. p.107 B.
heap up, accumulate, AB 432, Hsch. s.v. ἀποθησαμένη.
renunciation of a claim, PLond. 3.1007.18 (vi A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: disinheriting, PMasp. 97 ii 53 (vi A. D.).
prohibition, Iamb. VP 28.138 (pl., dub.).
stretched at length, Luc. Zeux. 4, Ael. NA 4.21; ἀ. τρέχειν Poll. 6.175.

diffusely, prolixly, Philostr. VS 1 Praef., cf. 1.15.4; ξυνέστειλε τοὺς χοροὺς ἀ. ὄντας Id. VA 6.11; ἀ. φθεγγόμενον [φθέγμα κηρύκων] Poll. 4.94; also with κατά, τῶν κατὰ ἀ. λόγων ἀκήκοας Herm. in Phdr. p.184A.

data.quote: κατά, τῶν κατὰ ἀ. λόγων ἀκήκοας

children.definition: one must exclude, Ἡρακλέα τῶν χθονίων θεῶν Philostr. VA 8.7.9.
anchorite, hermit, POxy. 1311 (v A. D.).

definition: ἀποτακτικός, ὁ, = foreg., PFlor. 71.722 (iv A. D.).
ἀποτακτῖται, οἱ, name of a heretical sect, Anatolian Studies p.86 (iv/v A.D.):— ἀποτακ-τισταί ( -τῆρες) is f.l. in Jul. Or. 7.224b.

children.definition: set apart for a special use, σιτία Hdt. 2.69; ἀπότακτον, τό, ‘speciality’, Philem. 76; ἀ. χρεία Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.4.7.

settled, appointed, ἡμέρα Critias 6.27 D.; fixed, ἐκφόριον PTeb. 42.12 (ii B. C.); φόρος POxy. 280.17 (i A. D.), etc.:— Subst. ἀπότακτον, τό, fixed rent, ib. 1124.9 (i A. D.); prescribed sum, PFay. 39 (ii A. D.), Porph. Abst. 4.17; ἱερὸν ἀ. imperial assessment, POxy. 1662.14 (iii A. D.).
set apart for punishment, Herod. 3.69; cf. ἄπακτος.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -τως in isolation, Phld. D. 3 Fr. 1.
larder, Cael.Aur. CP 3.21 (fort. -ιεία):— Adj. ἀπο-τᾰμιακός, ή, όν, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).338.
lock up, keep, Ael. VH 1.12, cf. PSI 4.428.28 (iii B.C.).

definition: ἀποτάμνω, Dor. and Ion. for ἀποτέμνω.

children.definition: Hp. Fract. 8.
separate assessment for tribute, Antipho Fr. 55.
suffer hell, ἐν ταῖς ἀποβολαῖς ταῖς χρημάτων Phld. Herc. 1251.20.
lengthening, prolongation, ὅσων ἔστιν ἀ. τῆς φωνῆς, i.e. ὅσων ἀποτείνεται ἡ φωνή, Arist. HA 545a17. cf. de An. 420b8.
stretching out, τῆς χειρός Sor. 1.101; τῶν ποδῶν Plu. QConv. 2.670d; τετάνου ἴδιον ἡ ἐς εὐθὺ ἀ. Aret. SA 1.6.

data.quote: τετάνου ἴδιον ἡ ἐς εὐθὺ ἀ.

children.definition: distension, of the breast, Sor. 1.87.
reference, ἡ ἀ. πρὸς Κλυταιμήστραν Sch. S. El. 1070, cf. A.D. Synt. 35.28, al.

set apart, assign specially, χώραν τινί Pl. Tht. 153e; detach soldiers, Plb. 6.35.3, etc., cf. POxy. 475.27 (ii A. D.):— Pass., ἀποτεταγμένη ἀρχή distinct office, Arist. Pol. 1322a26; ἀποτεταγμένοι τῇ κατοικίᾳ χρηματισταί PFay. 12 (ii B. C.): generally, to be fixed, appointed, χῶρος Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.120b; ear-mark, ἀργύριον εἰς δημοθοινίαν -τεταγμένον IG 12(7).515.91 ( Amorgos), cf. BCH 46.397 ( Mylasa).

children.label: II
children.definition: appoint, settle definitely, Arist. HA 585b36.

children.label: III
children.definition: remove, exclude, τόπον τοῦ κόσμου Philostr. VA 3.35; ἑαυτόν τινων Id. Im. 2.19.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀποτάσσομαί τινι bid adieu to a person, part from them, Ev.Luc. 9.61, Act.Ap. 18.21, Ev.Marc. 6.46, J. AJ 11.8.6, BGU 884 ii 14 (ii/iii A. D.), Aesop. 64, Lib. Decl. 45.28; have done with, get rid of a person, POxy. 298.31 (i A. D.); ἀ. τῷ βίῳ commit suicide, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8 (3). 136.17: also c. dat. rei, renounce, give up, τοῖς ἑαυτοῦ ὑπάρχουσιν Ev.Luc. 14.33; τροφῇ J. AJ 11.6.8; ταῖς μίξεσι, of the Vestals, Sor. 1.32; πάθεσι Ph. 1.116, cf. Iamb. VP 3.13, Phryn. 15.
to be like a bull, δέργμα λεαίνης ἀποταυροῦται δμωσίν casts the savage glance of a lioness on them, E. Med. 188 (lyr.).
to be changed into a heifer, Erot. s.v. κερχνώδεα.
apart from the bull, Arist. HA 595b19.
not buried in oneʼs ancestral tomb, Din. Fr. 16.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: buried separately, IG 12(1).656 ( Rhodes), Hsch., EM 131.43.
circumvallation, D.H. 9.9 (pl.).
fence off with a ditch, X. An. 6.5.1, HG 5.4.38; for defence or offence, D.H. 2.37, 3.41.
